ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face registration listings changed to A-Z
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi @Dan, We've recently noticed that for workshop registrations, the format of the listings for those currently enrolled in a listed workshop has changed from the order in which registrations are received, to A-Z listings based on first name when viewing as admin user. As the formatting has changed to A-Z, it's now unclear whether the waitlist function would still be able to track next-in-line if someone registered cancels their registration. Therefore, if a workshop becomes full and several individuals are waitlisted, is the first waitlisted person still offered a position first? Does the waitlist function recognise a time-stamp of when people register to manage this, or is this new A-Z listing structure likely to impact the waitlist function for students? We look forward to your advice.

Does anyone have a video they can share of the F2F in action - planned calendar, booking people on, emails sent and taking attendance. I hope someone will be able to help me with this. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Version 5.x support
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Team, Do you have any plans or timeframe for the release of a Version 5.x plugin?  If not, will 4.5 work in Version 5.x? Steve

ResponsesInList.Title: Version 5.x support
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Steve, We are unable to provde timeframes on new version support or roadmaps for any of our open source plugins to the community - this is something we can only provide as a commercial service to clients that have an SLA with us. Best thing to do is to check the plugins db "stats" page which shows that 29 registered Moodle sites running 5.0 also have the facetoface plugin installed: https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_facetoface/stats then test it in your own install and report any specific issues you find to the issues tracker in github. thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Face to Face emails not pulling through custom fields after upgrade

The other sites, I was able to leave the last version of f2f on and there work fine. It worked fine before the upgrade. I've tried a downgrade of the plugin, which moodle refuses to do. Participant: [firstname] [lastname] Course: [facetofacename] Cost: [cost] Duration: [duration] Date(s): [alldates] Moodle 4.4 (Build: 20240422) Face to Face v 2024052700

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face emails not pulling through custom fields after upgrade
ResponsesInList.Text: a couple of days later on the whole site the variables are showing. I've reinstalled it was fixed for a day.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face emails not pulling through custom fields after upgrade
ResponsesInList.Text: that suggests something is wrong with your lang files - either you've got some permissions wrong on the mod/facetoface/lang folder - or it's missing but this is a local issue with your site - you could try deleting the mod/facetoface folder in your site, then adding it back and clearing your cache to see if it helps?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face emails not pulling through custom fields after upgrade
ResponsesInList.Text: HI Dan I restored the folder back to when it worked. It fixed the issue for about a week, then for no apparent reason the error came back. the only change made to the site was a couple of plugins were updated, not the F2F plugin though. now restoring it doesn't fix it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face emails not pulling through custom fields after upgrade
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok I've fixed it again. I put an older version of the plugin files on, it said it can't downgrade, put the new version back on and it updated the database , and all is working again. There was a couple of plugins upgraded at the same time. see how long it lasts.

ResponsesInList.Title: Time Zone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All We're just moving our training operations over to Moodle 4.3 and with a fairly global reach we really need to be able to schedule Face to Face sessions in different time zones. Is there any easy way to do this and for the time zone to appear in any API call to pull F2F session data from the database ? Thanks in advance Rgds Bob

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time Zone
ResponsesInList.Text: By default the sessions should all show in the user's own timezone, so if an event is scheduled in US Central Timezone for 10:00 AM, but the viewing users is in India, the viewer will see it as scheduled at 9:30 PM. I believe at the database level the data is stored as a unix timestamp.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add/Remove Attendees - search for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi folks, We have an older version of Moodle (3.9.3 I believe - for a variety of reasons we can't currently shift to a newer version at the moment) with Face2Face - and one of our biggest issues is we need to do manual enrolment for each user, and then manually add them to the attendee list of events when we're doing bulk uploads for people who attended a session. This is a pretty common need in our LMS, as even though most groups within our organisation use F2F as intended, there are some that we need to add manually. So my query is this - is there a way to search users in bulk through the "add/remove attendees" screen? I'm aware that it seems to use the core moodle "add potential users" search function, or whatever the appropriate name for this bit is - and I've searched quite a bit without getting a definitive answer. What I'd like to be able to do is copy+paste a bunch of email addresses or usernames into the search and have it search for multiple at once, but I can't find a method. Is this even possible? Currently no matter what syntax I use in this search area I can't find a way to search for more than one email address at a time. My main reason for asking is that in other areas of the LMS (such as bulk enrolments) it seems quite doable. Cheers, Allan.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add/Remove Attendees - search for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: We need this functionality across all methods of enrollment - selecting single users is a chore. Additionally, if they are enrolled, they should automatically be added to the attendees. In that use case, we would only have to remove them as attendees if they cancelled the session. I have made cohorts for common enrollments and that speeds up the process. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add/Remove Attendees - search for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: My issue isn't so much selecting the users, but searching for them. How do Cohort enrolments fix the issue for you? Because I can't find a way to search for more than a single user and add them to the attended users at the event.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add/Remove Attendees - search for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: You are correct the current UI design does not allow to search for students for any of the enrollment methods. How a cohort can make life easier is if you have a group of students taking a set of courses. You create the cohort once and then just add the cohort to the course(s). An "old school" approach to is to create the cohort Site Administration>Users>Accounts>Cohorts>Add new cohort, Cohorts>Bulk user actions you can then use the various selection criteria values to build the desire cohort. Select Add to cohort and then adjust the cohort membership as needed. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add/Remove Attendees - search for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: This is actually something I hadn't considered before, because I just realised I can bulk add to a cohort using the bulk user actions dialog so that's useful! But I still can't see a way to add a cohort's attendees using the "Add Attendees" section in the FacetoFace plugin.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add/Remove Attendees - search for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: This won't necessarily help in the short term, if you're unable to upgrade; however, in the latest versions of the plugin for 4.0 and 4.1 there is an option limit_candidates which when enabled only shows already enrolled users in the F2F selector. So if you did have a bulk enrollment option of just the candidates you want to add to a specific session you could enroll them first and then it's a simple matter of adding everyone in the F2F selector.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Add/Remove Attendees - search for multiple users
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, that's at least helpful in that event, ha. Part of the problem we have on our end is we don't have direct server access, so making option changes isn't really available unfortunately. I imagine that given a lot of the courses we are taking attendees from number in the high thousands this might not actually make a big difference anyway!

ResponsesInList.Title: Road map for F2F or contact to a development company selling a more advanced plugin?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi ave used Totara for several years and am now using moodle with the f2f plugin. I am missing some options in the moodle plugin and am wondering if there is any road map for the current F2F or if you know any moodle development  companies who sells a fork of F2F with more functionality, such as the ability to turn of notifications, stop ical sending out on bulk, rich editor etc?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Road map for F2F or contact to a development company selling a more advanced plugin?
ResponsesInList.Text: HI Jeanette, Moodle Workplace also has a facetoface style feature and I think they have an ongoing roadmap for overall improvements, so you might find that Workplace might also suit your needs. We don't have a roadmap for the open source plugin - we try to make sure that it continues to work in future releases, but feature development is completely reliant on community contributions or clients directly funding a specific feature improvement. If you're interested in funding development on the open source facetoface activity, feel free to reach out privately and we can look at providing an estimate to implmement the features you are looking for. thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Signup for more than one session
ResponsesInList.Text: When a student signs up for a session, they cannot signup for a second one unless the cancel the other one first. Is there a setting or option for signing up for more than one session at a time?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Signup for more than one session
ResponsesInList.Text: Are both of the sessions delivering the same content? Session 21-Dec-2021 is Calculus 101. Session 25-Dec-2021 is Calculus 201. If the session is different course content - this should be its own Face-to-Face course so the students can book into both sessions. Otherwise- if the content is the same, why does the student need to take the same course twice? Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Signup for more than one session
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shirley and thank you for the reply. The sessions are not delivering the same content, and it would be basically a list with more than 10 sessions in one course for example, that each student has to participate in at least 5 of them. Therefore I would need an option for them to be able to signup for more than one at a time under the same face2face.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Signup for more than one session
ResponsesInList.Text: in concept, if you want to have different, related content in the same course, you need to add a new face-to-face activity and not just add another session to the existing activity. Course Moodle Administrations Face-to-Face Activity - Creating a Course Session 1 8:00-10:00am Session 2 1:00-3:00pm Face-to-Face Activity - Enrolling Students Session 1 11:00-11:30am Session 2 4:00-4:30pm Face-to-Face Activity - Generating Reports Session 1 ... Session 2 ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Signup for more than one session
ResponsesInList.Text: Understood. Thank you a lot for the explanations Shirley. Kind regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 3.8.1 Face-to-Face SQL query
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, sorry if this has been asked, I have searched and can't find anything relevant. I work in a hospital in the UK, and have a couple of major software deployments later on this year.  I've got E-Learning added and mandatory competency skills checks scheduled using the Face-to-face module starting in October. I have to report to the Trust board on a fortnightly basis. Until the competency checks have begun and we start marking students as having completed the check, I need to report on the face-to-face bookings made. Every User in the course (1500+) is enrolled as a student and added to a group (so I can track where they actually work and their work role, (ie., central theatres, Practitioner). I use Configurable Reports in my Moodle instance, and have a lovely report that I put together to show every enrolled user, their group, and whether they have been marked as competent (completed by a trainer) when they have successfully completed the mandatory skills check. This report works beautifully. Until we start doing the competency skills checks my reporting criteria is that users are scheduled on to a competency check.  Once we hit 90% of users scheduled the focus moves to competency skills checks successfully completed. So, I can get the students, in groups, who have completed the skills check, in one single report, using the Configurable Reports plugin. To get the scheduled users, I have to export the face-to-face sessions to a spreadsheet, create a unique ID, copy in to the configurable report downloaded spreadsheet, then do VLOOKUPs and CountIF(s) to get the percentage of users in each group who are scheduled for a check. Can anyone help me get this on to one configurable report please?  I've been trying, but having no look. Here's the configurable report to get the username, group and completion status for the competency skills check: *********************************** SELECT c.shortname AS Course, g.name AS Groupname, u.firstname, u.lastname, CONCAT(u.firstname ,'',u.lastname) AS 'Unique ID', er.enrol AS enrolmethod,  FROM_UNIXTIME(cc.timecompleted) AS CompletionDate FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_groups AS g ON g.courseid = c.id JOIN prefix_groups_members AS m ON g.id = m.groupid JOIN prefix_user AS u ON  m.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_enrol AS er ON er.courseid = c.id JOIN prefix_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid = er.id AND ue.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_course_completions AS cc ON cc.course = c.id AND cc.userid = u.id WHERE c.id = %%COURSEID%% ***************************************** I'd be forever in your debt Thanks in advance if anyone can help Alan
Just in case it's of any use to anyone I've just pushed a build that works on Moodle 3.9

ResponsesInList.Title: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I did a lot of search and found that there were some PHP code hack in the year of 2012 discussion. But later discussions are saying that Face-to-Face are meant to be for one session only registration. If someone wants to re-register for a future session, they would have to be marked as "No-show" for the session that they registered before. However, we have very large population of participants and very few people to actually watch the attendance. It would be hard to compare each person and mark people who didn't show up as no-show.  Is there a way to just open up the registration list to allow multiple signing up? Thanks!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am also looking for a solution for this. Does anyone have the hack they can post here? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I've been using face-to-face for 11 years and the answer has been NO the whole time. Marking them anything will allow them to re-register. Just mark each session. If you don't care if they actually attend or not, mark everyone attended... And for the inevitable next question, (can we have a select all?) probably not. I've asked the question several times over the years and again, the answer has been no. But it sure would be nice. I've heard the original developers have taken f2f up several levels but I don't think the new code is available to the community (and, that might just be hearsay).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Melanie. As to marking them anything - I cannot see that option at the moment?? Finally do you know of any other booking systems that allow this in Moodle? Was looking at 'Booking', but I cannot actually test it on moodlebites cause it doesn't let me create a new account. Essentially we run a series of workshops at different times and we want students to be able to sign up to multple AND receive email confirmations and notifications. Any help much appreciated. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: If it does not give you the option to take attendance, the date is still in the future. You can only take attendance after the session begins. Back in '08, still in the days of 1.9...I did a bunch of research on something like this. I found nothing that has the functionality of f2f...attendance might be more what you're looking for...but I think it tracks more of a day to day thing and, again, requires marking. At my prior job, we customized f2f to add an attendance by id option. We all had magnetic strip ID badges that had our id numbers coded in, so we could connect a usb swiper (or use a keyboard with a swiper) and as people walked in, they could swipe for attendance. Or the teacher could type in their ID's manually. Or could copy the list of swipes and paste it in for additional sessions (we frequently had back to back classes and people were required to attend several on the same day). It was pretty slick. The guy who wrote the code said it wasn't too hard. But that was a code hack and I can't share it...I don't work there any longer and they a) stopped using moodle and b) were resistant to sharing (I don't know why, the director was like that. Didn't like Moodle or open source, liked secret squirrel, now he's paying over $50,000 a year for something that doesn't have the flexibility Moodle has).

ResponsesInList.Title: Question and answers in moodle

ResponsesInList.Text: This is not a F2F question... You could use Database (not my recommended), Book, Glossary. I like glossary. the 'term' is your question. The 'definition' is your answer. Book would work, too, each page is the question and the content would be the answer.

ResponsesInList.Title: Guest access to Face-to-Face not working
ResponsesInList.Text: Beating my head against the desk right now. Using Moodle 3.6.3 with Boost theme. Been trying for two days to get Face-to-Face sessions working with guest access. Have gone through every site admin setting I can find, including: Settings>Site administration>Plugins>Authentication> Manage authentication Settings>Site administration>Plugins>Enrollments> Guest access Settings>Site administration>Plugins>Enrollments> Manage enroll plugin Settings>Site administration>Users>Permissions> Define roles Settings>Site administration>Users>Permissions> User policies I've set all courses to allow guests to view and enroll, system-wide by default. I've turned on auto-enroll. I've double-checked each FtF session and ensured that guest access is on. Guests system-wide have access to enroll in any session. Have set it so no password is required to enroll. There are no restrictions in place at the course, topic or session level. Guest access has never had a password requirement, so it seems unlikely that it has a corrupted password. Every time I click sign up for a session, I get, "Sorry, guests are not allowed to sign up for sessions."

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Guest access to Face-to-Face not working
ResponsesInList.Text: Guests can access the course but they cannot access activities .  Of they are not enrolled in the class, the class won't have a way to track them.  I suppose you could override guest roles but that is not one I would recommend changing.  The point of requiring people to be students is to track what they are doing--guest access is not tracked, therefore having them participate is pointless...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Guest access to Face-to-Face not working
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply. Yeah, the guest thing is unorthodox, but I was looking into that route thanks to a bureaucratic snafu. We will be offering computer training classes on this platform. Most of the students will have access via LDAP or OAuth, but there will be times when we have some warehouse folks taking courses as well, and most of them do not have either of those login options. (We were, of course, not informed of this until way into the process of setting up the server and the software, go figure). We were also told late in the game that some warehouse managers might want to bulk enroll their employees. The biggest issue is that (as near as I can tell), Moodle requires each student to have an email address. While I completely understand the need for that, it really limits our options for solving the problem. HR won't let them use personal emails. I'd just have them all register under their manager's email address, but I'm pretty sure Moodle doesn't allow that, either. Any ideas would be greatly appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Guest access to Face-to-Face not working
ResponsesInList.Text: AH!  Well, you could create fake emails. But then they wouldn't get notices...but it sounds like they might not anyway. Yea, Moodle does require each account to have an email and usually prevents duplicates BUT I think you can disable that...or create accounts via a bulk upload with the duplicated email--just make sure to change the prevent duplicate emails from yes to no. If HR doesn't want them to use personal email then they need to make sure they have company emails.

ResponsesInList.Title: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have been configuring a face-to-face activity and have noticed that when I mark a learner as 'no show', then the activity is still being set as 'complete' for them. Is there any way to tie passing grade to completion in this activity type? Thanks, Bruce

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately not at this time. Partially attended gets recorded as a 50, fully attended as 100, and no show as a zero. Those are all grades, so completion is triggered for all of them. I usually recommend using grade restrictions on a later activity that has more robust completion options, such as feedback, to trigger course completion.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: How would I set course completion to only occur for example for a grade of 100%? I have several sessions that a learner can choose from, they only need to attend one fully to pass... Is that possible through grade book? If so, can you provide an example? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: Set a grade to pass and it won't give completion. So...step 1, must receive a grade (but not view, that can jack things up massively). Step 2: Grades, Gradebook setup, Edit/Edit settings for the F2F, Set your Grade to pass to 50 or 100 (whatever you expect). Save.  You might need to click Show more to see the Grade to pass.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: At least in my testing on the latest version of the plugin and Moodle 3.5 and 3.6 that will still mark the activity as complete, but completed (did not achieve pass grade). So if course completion is tied to activity completion that will still mark as complete despite the no show. In some plugins there is an option to restriction completion to a passing grade, but F2F doesn't support that. So in this use case I would set the required course grade to 75 or 100 for course completion rather than rely on activity completion, or if there are other activities I would use a grade restriction instead of an activity completion to restrict access to the later activities. Jeremy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: F2F does work with passing grade, but you have to set it manually in the gradebook. There is not a specific 'require passing grade' the way quiz or other modules have within settings, though. I've been requiring a passing grade this way for course and activity settings for years...

ResponsesInList.Title: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there a way to change this setting? I have students who need to book different facetoface sessions throughout the week and they need to pick more than one session instead of creating another whole face to face activity. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity
ResponsesInList.Text: I have the same need. I hope there is a way to allow them to join or book for more than one session per each face to face activity. If anybody knows how to do this, please help. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe face to face are meant to create several identical sessions for the student to choose the best that fits his/her schedule. Let's say you have instructor lead course "Course 101". That course you will offer it in 3 different "schedules". So you create 3 sessions for the same course at 2 different schedules. The student is supposed to attend just one. The most suitable for his/her schedule. I hope that clarifies.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity
ResponsesInList.Text: If you give the student (fully attended, no show, etc) credit for attending, it opens it up for sign up again. It only blocks if there is an open un-graded session.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can I turn off all notifictions in Face-to-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am setting up some classroom events using this plugin, but many of our students do not access their email and would find the notifications and reminders bothersome. For sessions in the past, the plugin has the logic to turn off the reminders and displays session over on the course activity. For future sessions I was hoping for single checkbox on the initial page to "turn-off" all reminders. Then of course there is most hoping that administrators (instructors) would have a easy way of marking the attendance for all enrolled (select all) and allowing them to select the date of the event vs the current date. Instructors/administrators often do not receive the attendance roster on the same day as the event. Kind Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I turn off all notifictions in Face-to-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I doubt it.  If you manually register (and then properly enroll, sense manual registration may add people to the course with no role), you can check the 'don't send email' box but I have never seen a way to block it if people sign themselves up. They can choose whether to get one or two emails but not to shut off email entirely. There is no native way to take attendance for everyone--at a previous job one of my techy coworkers wrote a script to add a link to the options which opened a page where you could enter an id number for each attendee and then submit in bulk.  It would also manually enroll people who showed up without signing up.  It was pretty slick.  But it did require an ID number. Our staff had a badge with an embedded code for their ID so they could swipe into the job sites...his code added something that with a USB swiper would read the id and made it super fast. Unfortunately, I don't have that code.  I thought he posted it for the community many years ago but have not been able to find it if he did...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I turn off all notifictions in Face-to-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Melanie, That was super helpful. I have many classroom sessions over the next few weeks and the thought of marking attendee one-by-one and answering the pop-up is making my brain numb. I will dream on....and click away. Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Importing data into Face to Face format from old LMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Howdy, Is there a way of importing data from and existing Learning Management System into a face to face format in Moodle for historical records. We are switching over to Moodle and have data from or old system which has the structure of multiple Classes within a course, the equivalent to multiple Sessions in a Topic in Moodle. Moving forward in Moodle, the structure we have set is: 1. within a course there are multiple topics (doing different things), 2. in one of the Topics of a Course there are multiple Face to Face activities (1 for each state  the course is presented in 3. In each fact to Face activity there are multiple sessions which are run in each State We want to be able to import all the historical classes into the session within each state activity of face to face. We have tried it, and each imported class becomes its own course with blank topics in them. this then makes it hard as there becomes so many courses, and a mess. some of these courses prerequisites for future course, and instead of just making the prerequisite for 1 course, we will have to create it for every course (Too many) Please Help, I am a novice at this and the person which was assisting (which was more experienced) is no longer working for our company.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Importing data into Face to Face format from old LMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Dave, There isn't a straightforward way to do that in Moodle. You'd have to create the course shells and then manually import the data and mark the session attendance again for each one. There isn't anything out there for Moodle, at this moment, that will do this automatically. There are options in Totara though. Jeremy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Importing data into Face to Face format from old LMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I recently started using the course recompletion plug-in and it solves my bi-annual certification problems when the course content is on the LMS. However, I have other external courses that award certificates that I need to send out reminders to employees and their managers that the student has an approaching due date for recertification. Can I use face-to-face to create a course events in the past + the course recompletion plug-in to automate my external certifications? Kind Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't know anything about the recompletion plug-in, but you can create course events in the past--but you have to manually add attendees.  If you don't suppress notification, it will notify them as well--which might be what you want.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Melanie! Can I mark the student's participation in the past? Or will Moodle mark the participation as of the "current date"?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: Shirley, You can track past events using Face-to-face; however, the completion in Moodle will use the current date. Jeremy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for sharing with me. This is unfortunate that an administrator cannot set the student's participation date - I will not be able to use the course recompletion plug-in for my external certificate requirements. I guess I am back to manually tracking off-line.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: As an admin, you can always modify those dates.  I'm not recommending it, but it is possible--If you use adminer,  you can hunt down specific sessions and bulk change the completion dates and go to the course completion status and bulk change the completion date there, too.  Again...not advocating, just saying...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Shirley, You may want to consider using the Reengagement plugin and the Recompletion plugin in combination. Reengagement will remind/email users after a time frame has elapsed. Recompletion will strip out grades and notify users. This also renders the certificate unavailable to the user. We have found by using Custom Certificate that if the user repeats activities a new certificate will become available (even though the certificate summary page would suggest otherwise) I do not believe Recompletion has been adapted for face-to-Face use yet. Cheers Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create a 'Closed' F2F to prevent user signup

If so, I'd limit capacity to 1 and sign someone up.  Then it would be 'at capacity' and would prevent students from accessing it.  The teacher can add people even when the session says it is full.

ResponsesInList.Title: Face to face attendance and course completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello,  I am finding that in certain cases when marking a student as fully attended on a course this isn't updating the activity completion settings. Am I correct to expect that if a face to face activity setting is 'student must receive a grade' then when a student attendance is marked as 'fully attended' the activity will be marked as complete? In some of our face to face activities students are manually added to a session.  They are, therefore, never 'active' on the course, would this effect them being marked as complete, even if they have been marked 'fully attended'? With many thanks, Helen

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to face attendance and course completion
ResponsesInList.Text: Generally, that should be correct.  Did you ensure you did not check the 'student must view the activity' box--that would prevent completion.  Are students able to look, even if they don't have to? I tend to also add a grade to pass in the gradebook (too bad the newer versions don't include this in activity settings the way Quiz and Lesson do)--because it considers a 0 a grade and will give completion for a 0--but if you do all of it manually, maybe that never happens for you. Another issue I've seen is sometimes an activity will get locked in the gradebook somehow (no one ever knows how it happens) and then it won't actually register the grade or the completion.  If you go to the grade book and go to Gradebook setup, edit settings for the activity in question, there is a locked box and, if you open the More option, a timed lock.  I'd guess that isn't the problem, but it does happen (at my previous job it happened at least once a year to someone and we had about 1500+ facetoface activities going).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to face attendance and course completion
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe if you use Face-to-face to pull a student into a course, often they have no role. Your grade book may be configured to not display/consider users without a role. We always enrol users into a course manually then use the F2F module as a seat booking/ attendance recording activity. this works for us. Cheers Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to face attendance and course completion

If the enrollment is the problem--go to Participants and add the student or equivalent role to each user.  it may take a bit of time for the sync to work but it will fix it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple date, multiple ics?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I just made a session that excist of two dates (lets say 5-4-2018 and 6-4-2018). When i register for it i only get an .ics fot the first date (5-4-2018) Is it possible to get both dates in a .ics file or  .ics file for each date?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple date, multiple ics?
ResponsesInList.Text: If they are consecutive dates, then just use one start/finish time. i.e  Start 9:30 5-4-2018 and Finish 17:00 6-4-2018. The ical will work then. If they have different start times on each day, then the Face-to-face does not send separate ical attachments for each addtional date in a session.  Feature/bug As we want to record attendance for each session, we set them up separately and ask the students to sign up for the sessions they need to attend.  By copying sessions, It is almost as quick setting them up as it is adding new dates to one session.

ResponsesInList.Text: I should probably start a new message thread for this but... I am running a heavily hacked version of Face to Face and am having a problem with the module not retrieving the 'details' from a session when it is edited. I mean, when a user (teacher or admin) clicks on the edit button to edit a session, the details for that session are not retrieved and the html editor is thus blank. If the user changes the time, for example, and then saves the edit, the details are effectively erased. We have had this problem for a long time and have put up with it but now that I've managed to update everything for 3.2 (including the date issue discussed here) I was hoping to fix this issue but am stuck. I've poked around in sessions.php and view.php for so long now that I'm starting to get bug eyed. I wonder if anyone might have any ideas about where I should look? For reference, we are using a version of the Face to face module that: 1. Allows for multiple reservations within one instance of face to face (multiplession version) 2. Allows for a maximum number of reservations per one month period (adjustable via in module setting) 3. Allows for reservation lock if students miss more than a set number of sessions (without canceling) 4. Removes the ability to cancel from one hour prior to the start of the session with a direct contact (via phone) message displayed. 5. Prevents users from making more that a set number of reservations per day (adjustable via in module setting) 6. Has customized attendance settings to enable #3 above to function Due to all these customizations, I basically have to keep this version but would love to get this little bug fixed. Regards Jason

ResponsesInList.Title: Signing up to multiple sessions in Facetoface 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Alastair, This is a wonderful contribution! Thanks for all of your hard work. I have successfully installed the latest version on Moodle 2.2.1+ and have, thus far, had no issues. I have one request that may be a big one but I wanted to propose it here to see if others would be interested as well as to see if I could get some feedback on how difficult it would be to include. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Official Facetoface 2.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jason, The source of the difficulty is that the way it was originaly built in the face to face module is that attendance and grade are actually the same field, e.g. if you mark someone as fully attended they get a 100 on that field, partially attended 50 and did not attend 0. We have an initial solution for this, by calculating an average score based on this attendance for the entire activity if a user is signed up to more than one session. This will be up for review soon by Alastair, I hope. Amir

There is only one value per face-to-face activity but now with multiple sessions per activity this poses a problem. Sorry, I didn't quite get it when I posted the message above. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I would like a print attendance register option
ResponsesInList.Text: There is an additional entry called superceded - if you only show those with 0 in this table, it will filter out those who have cancelled. I did think the status code was 70 though, not 50? I use a similar thing - config report below. Note - discountcode I use to produce a blank cell for the signature - we don't use discount code. select c.shortname, f.name AS SessionName, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timestart),'%e %M %Y')  AS 'Date', DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timestart),'%h:%i %p') AS 'Time', u.username AS 'Payroll Number',  CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) AS Name, fs.discountcode AS Signature from prefix_user AS u INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_signups as fs on u.id=fs.userid INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions_dates as fsd on fs.sessionid=fsd.sessionid INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions AS fse

ResponsesInList.Title: Report on which enrolled students have not signed up to a F2F session
ResponsesInList.Text: I was wondering if there's any kind of report I can run to tell me which enrolled students on a course are yet to sign up to any of the sessions available for a mandatory F2F activity?  I'd like to send a chaser email to all enrolees who are yet to sign up to a session. Thanks Emily

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Report on which enrolled students have not signed up to a F2F session
ResponsesInList.Text: It has to be done via SQL . You basically need to pull the enrolled users, and then exclude those booked/attended in your facetoface session. It would be something like this: SELECT u.id, u.username, u.firstname, u.lastname, u.email FROM mdl_role_assignments ra JOIN mdl_user u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN mdl_role r ON r.id = ra.roleid JOIN mdl_context cxt ON cxt.id = ra.contextid JOIN mdl_course c ON c.id = cxt.instanceid WHERE ra.userid = u.id AND ra.contextid = cxt.id AND cxt.contextlevel =50 AND cxt.instanceid = c.id The nested SELECT could probably use less joins (the session date table is complete unnecessary in this case, for example), I simply grabbed it from another query I had saved.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time in reminder emails is not correct.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Matteo, We currently assume that the server timezone is the same as the user timezone. It would be good to remove that assumption. If you wanted to change this, have a look at all uses of "userdate()" in /mod/facetoface/lib.php The optional third parameter to userdate() is the timezone. For each user we send an email to, we should use his/her own timezone. Let me know if you get somewhere with this. I'd be happy to get this fixed. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time in reminder emails is not correct.
ResponsesInList.Text: Ciao Regarding the email notification, maybe the best/easiest solution (that doesn't not require ALL the users set correctly their timezone) is sending to all the users the same absolute time (for instance from 09:00 UTC to 17:00 UTC) Regarding the ICAL file, the ICAL appointment should contain an absolute time (for instance UTC): the Calendar Clients will convert the absolute time to a localtime using the user's timezone (in MS Outlook, Google Calendar,... you can set your timezone) Regards Matteo

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time in reminder emails is not correct.
ResponsesInList.Text: I agree with using UTC for the iCal attachments. They should be displayed properly by the client. On the other hand, in the emails, we should be using the user timezone (as set in Moodle) because that's what users will see when they are logged in and sign up for the session. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time in reminder emails is not correct.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time in reminder emails is not correct.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Matteo, I made i small modifcation to the code, because the localserver timezone was hardcoded. If you want to obtain it dinamically you can use a function to calculate the delta between the local time and UTC . So the code should look like this : $timezonul=$USER->timezone; ( or $timezonul=$user->timezone) if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()>=0) ) { $timezonul = "+".tzdelta() ;} else if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()<0)) {$timezonul = tzdelta();} function tzdelta ( $iTime = 0 ) { if ( 0 == $iTime ) { $iTime = time(); } $ar = localtime ( $iTime ); $ar[5] += 1900; $ar[4]++; $iTztime = gmmktime ( $ar[2], $ar[1], $ar[0], $ar[4], $ar[3], $ar[5], $ar[8] ); return ( $iTztime - $iTime ) /3600; } Now you can elimnate also the + sign after the UTC string and so you will have corect data even for servers with localtime bellow 0 UTC . Please test it and tell me if it works for you. Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Issues vs Discussions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, As you may be aware this plugin is sometimes supported and sometimes not. There are a few reasons for this and I am trying to rectify some of those as I go through things and sorry for the delays. One problem that the community of users can help me with is the way in which issues are being reported. At the moment there are many different threads being opened - here, in the plugin directory feedback, github, private messages to me etc - sometimes reporting the same issue or something that might be resolved within a different version. This means that it is difficult to track the exact issues and clearly identify where and when things should be corrected and to let the community know of updated code. I have switched off bug reporting on the github directory itself in the hopes that the Moodle tracker itself becomes the only place for issues to be reported. I'd like to also build a roadmap for coming versions and feature improvements so having all the issues in one place will really help this plan moving forward. There have been, since I took over maintenance, a few things I'd like to add and alter but first I need to get the current code into a consistent state. If you experience a issue please first check the tracker to see if there is an item already reporting this which you can add to and/or vote on and if not then please create a new one. The forums and plugin comments should ideally be used only for questions regarding general support such as configuration questions, suggestions for features and their related discussions and general use or feedback of the module. I will not be able to support bugs reported in these locations. In the meantime, thank you for your patience, Stacey

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face to face and 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text: We are using it with 2.7+. I believe it does require the legacy log to be turned on, but if you are upgrading from an earlier version it should be on by default. However, just because it works for our environment doesn't mean it will work perfectly in your environment. Even if you only have one server I recommend doing a test install using a different folder in your webroot, a second copy of your moodledata folder, and a copy of your database . For our environment we always have at least three copies of our system running. One for testing active development projects, one for final code testing (which often serves as our upgrade testing platform), and our production setup.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manager/Supervisor approval problems

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manager/Supervisor approval problems
ResponsesInList.Text: Scott, I don't think either of these are a bug, but how the features are implemented. We don't use this functionality, so I'm going to have to do some testing, but the status of "Requested" is correct until it is approved. Face-to-face is an activity module, which means it exists within the context of a course, therefore, to access the module you must be enrolled in the course. That includes the managers that are doing the approvals. From my memory, once the manager is enrolled the first time in the future the link takes them directly to the approval page. Once the approval is submitted the status for the user should change to "Booked."

ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: I have recently come across an interesting question and would love some feedback... We use the Face-to-face activity to allow learners to sign up for in person sessions and we also use prerequisites to track learner progress, etc. If we have multiple sessions available for one Face-to-face activity and the requirement for the course completion is a grade (attendance) in the face-to-face activity does it effect the course completion if they only sign up for one session? Or for the course completion to work properly with the prerequisities would they have to sign up for each session? Sorry if that is really confusing... Thank you in advance for your time and/or ideas!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: It is my understanding that a user CANNOT sign up for more than one session in the same face to face activity. That is a problem for us, but in your case might be desirable. You can test this by setting up more than one session for a face to face and see if the same student can sign up to multiple sessions. To accomplish this in our setting we have to set up separate face to face activities , each with its own sessions. Your bigger problem might be that F2F counts any attendance status (Fully attended, partially attended, no show) as being a valid completion. This is also a problem for us but I have not had time to look into the solution that the followup message to this thread offers: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=225026

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mia, Hmm - I think you and I seem to face the same challenges. My other answer to the above is - I have remmed out the lines that have partially attended or no show - if someone doesn't show, the facilitator actually removes them from the session. This way, they have to get a "Attended" to get a course completion. Obviously this may not work for everyone. Incidently, I have a cancellation report, which picks out students that have cancelled sessions and why, and when the person cancelling the session is not the student, puts it as a "No Show" Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: yes I always read your face to face posts and it seems like we do have some of the same issues. Thanks for the info about the partially attended or no show -- we want to record no shows, though. We are working on a custom addition to Face to Face that adds another layer of approval after the manager approval so that an account number can be entered by a fund manager. In addition, the approval links that take the approvers to their approvals filter the approvals on the page so that only their own approvals show, AND the approver does not need the permission to the entire Attendees page if they use the link to access the approvals page. I hope that we can eventually get this code and some other code we are customizing in F2F incorporated into the main F2F module. Will tell more as it develops in case others are interested.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I was searching for something completely different in Google, and this came up, which reminded me, I finally after 18 months found the root cause of the issue. By default, Moodle sets the default grade to pass as 0 (who knows why...) Once you change this default to 100, then any F2F activity created will have the no show, partial attendence etc marked as failed, rather than passed. I then also did a cheeky back end database to all F2F sessions to have the gradetopass setting set to 100. I hope this helps someone else. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for your post, we have run into significant issues using the prerequisities for the face-to-face sessions and have decided to forego the use of prerequisites for this activity at this time but I will continue testing and let you know if I come across another alternative. Thank you for your time and have a wonderful day!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Piersante Once you setup Face2face every user will need to go into their individual user profile and enter an email address of their manager or a person who will approve their enrolment.  This is a must. The Face2face add-on uses a two-tier approval process. The first tier is the manager. Once the user sets their managers email address, they can go to a course and enrol. Upon their enrolment an email will be sent to their manager. The email will contacin a link for the manager to login and approve the enrolment. Once the manager has approved the enrolment, an email will be sent to the course coordinator /s. The course cordinator is anyone who has been given teacher or manager role within the course. You need to set these roles for every course. To approve the enrolment as a course coordinator, the person who has been allocated teacher or manager role for the course will log in and go to Site pages (left had side under home) and select Course coordinator approval. This is where the lis of students who have been approved to attend will show up for the course coordintor to approve to attend the course. Once the course coordinator approves the student, this completes the process. Please remember to set your course to use the Face2face add-on. Go to the course and under Users > Enrollment methods select Enrol Approval and move that to the top of the list (select the blue arrow). I normall delete the "Self enrolment (student)" if that is on the list. If it is grey out you dont need to worry. Manaul enrolments is normally at the bottom when using the Face2face add-on. You now need to set up your Face2face add-on by adding an activity. Go into the course, make sure editing is on and on the first topic you need to add a activity. Find the Face-to-face activity and select Add. You must add a name. I suggest you type in the name of the course as this will show up on the 2 emails as part of the enrolment process. You must check the following boxes: Approval required. Send notice to manager (confirmation message) Send notice to manager (Reminder message) Send notice to manager (Cancellation message) Click on Save and return to course Get a normal user with only student role to find the course and see is it asks you to enrol and put a justification in. Hope this helps Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot. Very clear and enlighting. The only information that was missing is that you must create an user field in the user profile and populate it with the manager email for each student, This is very different from what the FAQ say, as they suggest that the field is already there. Not only this was not clear from the documentation, but it is cumbersome, as the default manager address is only inherited by new (or updated) users. I had to open and save all the students profiles one by one, to let them to get it (I suspect that I could have added the email address to the data user field table directly in the database , but I didn't dare to try). I find it also illogical, as the manager would usually belong to the activity rather than to the students (students might have different facetoface activities , each with a different manager), so one would expect it to be defined in the session properties, rather than globally. Nevertheless, thanks to your note I was qickly able to put the module at work and I find it wonderful and very flexible. I now have one more question: the confirmation email has fields for venue, room and location, which in my case are empty. Where do you set them? thanks, piersante

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: "I now have one more question: the confirmation email has fields for venue, room and location, which in my case are empty. Where do you set them?" They are set as added custom fields in the settings for the face to face plugin: Site administration / Plugins / Activity modules / Face To Face Section - Custom Session Fields Create a new field for each of the 3 fields Note: I think the  short names need to be 'venue', 'location',  'room' - all lowercase. You can use capitals in the Name field.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Where should the manager's email address field be created, and what is its short name? TIA John

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John To create the manager's email address field : Go to: 1. Site administration  / ► Users/ ► Accounts/ ► User profile fields 2. When there select   "create new profile field” 3. Complete the settings for your new field: Common Settings: - Short name (must be unique): managersemail - Name: whatevername - Description: whatever ..... - Various Parameters : ... Specific Settings - Default value etc When done Click on Save Changes So the managers email must be created in the User Profile under Site administration. The shortname  = managersemail. Hope this is helpfull.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sessions on the course page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I have just pushed a patch for Moodle 2.6 that should ensure that the sessions are displayed on the course page according to the display number set in the instance configuration.  It is available on branch MOODLE_26_STABLE at https://github.com/catalyst/facetoface-2.0/commits/MOODLE_26_STABLE Apologies for the delay! Thanks, Stacey

ResponsesInList.Title: Backup without user data
ResponsesInList.Text: Guys, We have come across a small issue, when we back up a course not saving user data, the other thing that goes missing is the session information for the course. (Actually, anything which is held in the mdl_facetoface_session_data). However, if you do the backup with user data, and restore without user data, then it works. The issue is within the backup_facetoface_stepslib.php - line 128 $session_data_element->set_source_table('facetoface_session_data', array('sessionid' => backup::VAR_PARENTID)); which does the back up of the data only if user data is selected. I would recommend it be removed out of the user backup section and place it in the data backup section. (I moved it to line 121 before the line if ($userinfo) { This allows things like location to be backed up without user data. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is anyone using Moodle Face to Face with Microsoft Exchange as your Email Server?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Alrighty! I got the solution up here . I hope this helps out some folks. In the interest of searchability, I've c-n-p'd the current text below. Visit the link above the updated info. Thanks, -PCP The Problem Moodle's Face-to-Face module sends you an iCal invite that is not properly interpreted by MS Outlook client. The iCal invite comes through as a blank attachment. Apparently the iCal worked just fine on OWA and on Evolution running on Linux. Our Environment Moodle v.1.94+ MS Exchange server 2003 (don't know which patch level). Disclaimer The changes below are what got my problem fixed at work. I don't guarantee that it will work for you. Use this information at your own risk. I also won't pretend this is the best solution out there. I am positive it can be improve in many ways. If you have problems with this solution and if I have the time to revisit this in the future I may look into it. A Tentative Solution Change the /moodle/moodlelib.php and the /moodle/mod/facetoface/lib.php files on the following fashion: moodle/mod/facetoface/lib.php Around line 1374, change this code: 
```text
if
 
(
!
email_to_user
(
$user
,
 
$fromaddress
,
 
$attachment
[
'subject'
]
,
 
$attachment
[
'body'
]
,


$attachment
[
'htmlbody'
]
,
 
$attachment
[
'filename'
]
,
 
$attachmentfilename
)
)
 
{
```
 into this: 
```text
if
 
(
!
email_to_user
(
$user
,
 
$fromaddress
,
 
$attachment
[
'subject'
]
,
 
file_get_contents
(
$CFG
->
dataroot
 
.
 
'/'
 
.

 
$attachment
[
'filename'
]
)
,
'ical'
)
)
 
{
```
 The change above will use the file attachment as the body if the user opted to send out an iCal invite and add a special marker ("ical") as the parameter for the changes we will make on the moodlelib.php moodle/moodlelib.php Around line 4117, after the global and static declarations, add the following code: 
```text
if
 
(
$messagehtml
 
==
 
'ical'
)
 
{

 
$messagehtml
 
=
 
''
;

 
$is_this_an_ical_request
 
=
 
TRUE
;


}
```
 This will set a control variable if the user chose to send an iCal. Then, around the new line 4283, right before the if ($mail->Send()) { , add the following code: 
```text
if
 
(
$is_this_an_ical_request
)
 
{

 
$mail
->
ContentType
 
=
 
'text/calendar; method=REQUEST; charset="UTF-8"'
;

 
$mail
->
Encoding
 
=
 
'quoted-printable'
;


}
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Any way to list face-to-face signups for all courses?
ResponsesInList.Text: We set up such a report using an SQL query on the Ad-Hoc SQL report for admins. I will find it and post it here.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Any way to list face-to-face signups for all courses?
ResponsesInList.Text: You can use the Ad-Hoc Query reports download here: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=2884 (and see here for more details on using it): http://docs.moodle.org/en/Custom_SQL_queries_report Then try defining and running this SQL query. It should provide a list of all face-to-face registrations, which can be view on screen or downloaded: select u.firstname as first_name, u.lastname as last_name, u.username as user_name, c.fullname as course_name, f.name as course_desc, FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timestart) as start_date, FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timefinish) as end_date, fs.location as location, fs.duration as duration, fs.normalcost as cost, c.currency as currency, fsd.sessionid as sid, fsub.userid as user_id, u.email as email from prefix_course c JOIN prefix_facetoface f ON c.id = f.course JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions fs ON f.id = fs.facetoface JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions_dates fsd ON fs.id = fsd.sessionid JOIN prefix_facetoface_submissions fsub ON fs.id = fsub.sessionid JOIN prefix_user u ON fsub.userid = u.id WHERE fsub.timecancelled=0 GROUP BY fsd.sessionid, fsub.userid ORDER BY course_name, start_date, user_id

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Any way to list face-to-face signups for all courses?
ResponsesInList.Text: I have found that the Face-to-Face block (version 20120719) does provide a list of all face-to-face sessions, including a count of bookings.   That fulfills my requirements. To get the list of all sessions, I just need to go to "My bookings" in the Face-to-Face block, and click on the Sessions tab. I might point out that the new version of the Face-to-Face block is apparently not available on the Moodle website, but is available at github - https://github.com/totara/facetoface-block-2.0 - and seems to work fine for me with Moodle v2.5

ResponsesInList.Title: iCal Class Set to Private - Any Way to Change That?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello!  The ics file sent with booking confirmations has its class set to private.  I found this in the code starting at 2825: BEGIN:VEVENT UID:{$UID} DTSTAMP:{$DTSTAMP} DTSTART:{$DTSTART} DTEND:{$DTEND} SEQUENCE:{$SEQUENCE} SUMMARY:{$SUMMARY} LOCATION:{$LOCATION} DESCRIPTION:{$DESCRIPTION} CLASS:PRIVATE TRANSP:OPAQUE{$CANCELSTATUS} ORGANIZER;CN={$ORGANISEREMAIL}:MAILTO:{$ORGANISEREMAIL} ATTENDEE;CUTYPE=INDIVIDUAL;ROLE={$ROLE};PARTSTAT=NEEDS-ACTION; Can that be changed to public?  I have users who are not happy about the appointment being set to private.  Their managers question why there is an appointment like that on their calendar. I tried to change that myself and lost my entire front page .  It just ... disappeared. I had to delete the mod and add it back.  Suggestions?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: iCal Class Set to Private - Any Way to Change That?
ResponsesInList.Text: We always switch ours. I'm pretty sure you have two options. One is to remove the class entirely (I'm pretty sure the default is public) or change PRIVATE to PUBLIC. I don't have access to my server at the moment, but can check our setup tomorrow to confirm the exact change.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: iCal Class Set to Private - Any Way to Change That?
ResponsesInList.Text: Jeremy, it would be very helpful if you could check out how to set that up.  When I tried to modify the code, I lost my Front Page for some reason.  I thought that was very odd...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: iCal Class Set to Private - Any Way to Change That?
ResponsesInList.Text: I did a quick check and in lib.php the class line reads as "CLASS:PUBLIC". That works for us without (to my knowledge) any negative consequences.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: iCal Class Set to Private - Any Way to Change That?
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok, thank you.  I guess I can try again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: iCal Class Set to Private - Any Way to Change That?
ResponsesInList.Text: It worked this time!

Error message is; Notice: Undefined property: stdClass::$department in /srv/www/xxx.yyy.eu/www/user/selector/lib.php on line 607. This message is shown for every student already booked. ResponsesInList.Title: Upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm in the process of upgrading from Moodle 1.9.19 to 2.2.6 (I realise these are ageing versions with limited-to-no support) which involved upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400 and there were multiple issues. To resolve these I had to make changes to mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php, I've attached the patch to this post. To summarise the issues: $dbman->add_field(), create_table() and drop_field() appears to return void so don't assign this to $result. (This appears to be already known: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=217299 ). $OUTPUT->notification() is an empty object, add $OUTPUT to the list of globals at the start of xmldb_facetoface_upgrade(). Property $DB->debug isn't accessible (protected) so remove these. The second parameter for $DB->get_records() should be either null or an array. The field list for $DB->get_records() should be in the fourth parameter. Unless of course there's something very wrong with my installation. All the best, Leon

ResponsesInList.Title: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois I noticed in the options for the f2f module that you can send a wait list message. How do I setup a wait listed f2f session? Currently when I create a session and fill the booking it removes it from the available sessions list and tells me the booking is full. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, What we mean by wait-listed session is slightly different than what you have in mind I think. A 'wait-listed session' in the Face-to-face module is a session for which no date is currently set. Users can then register their interest in attending a Face-to-face course even if it's not offered at this time. There is no way at this time to "exceed" the capacity of a given session but this can be approximated by adding a second session without a date on which users can sign-up if the other one is full.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois Thank you for the clarification. So if a user signs up for a 'wait-listed session' as you have described above what happens if a booking opens up in a non-wait-listed session? Can users be moved automatically from a wait-listed session to a non-wait-listed session? What would the process be in this case? Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: No, at the moment, the two sessions (the scheduled one and the wait-listed one) are completely separate. Thus the wait-list cannot be used to fill the spots of the people who cancel, unless the instructor manually adds them, or if they come back to the page by chance and see that a spot has freed up. It would probably be a good idea to implement something like that though. I'd have to think about how to do this while keeping the UI as simple as possible. If you have any ideas, I suggest that you create a new ticket in the tracker and describe how you see it working. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply. I have added CONTRIB-408 to the tracker. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm using the latest version of face to face in moodle 2.5 and the waitlist functionality seems to have no effect at all. ResponsesInList.Title: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature?
ResponsesInList.Text: OK - combining F2F with Activity Tracker, and we came across a curious instance where if a student was marked as a No Show in the Face to Face session, they were showing as successully completed the module. Of course, as I have customised both, I went back to basics to find it, and here is what I found. Regardless of the result of the Face to Face session, (Fully attended, partially attended, no show) Face to Face still injects a completion status of 1 into the table mdl_course_modules_completion . (Note - if course completion is set to require 100% to pass, this is not an issue - just reporting through Activity Tracker, which utilises the completionstatus flag in mdl_course_modules_completion ) Now one could argue either way for this - that they technically have completed the module, however got a pass mark of 0%, or they have not completed the module because they didn't turn up. Myself - I argue the second option - but interesting to see other thoughts out there. Any one with thoughts? Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: Actually, after a bit more work and investigating - it is not the F2F as such. By default with course completion, any grade is enough to complete. If you then go into grades, Grade Administration->Categories and items->Full View , then set the "Grade to Pass" to be higher than 0.(probably 100)  This then injects a 2 for a pass, or a 3 for a fail into the mdl_course_modules_completion module, and then need to modify the Activity Tracking to look for just a 1 or a 2, not anything that is inserted into the field. Simple when you know how????? Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: We don't make use of partial attendance or no show.  If we did use no show, I would NOT want it to indicate that the activity has been completed under Completion Tracking. Thanks for sharing your workaround.  Looks a bit complicated to me though.  I think it'll be easier for us if I just remove the option to select partial attendance or no show to prevent teachers from selecting those options. If we were to use "No show" on our system, I would want it to allow users to re-book another session. As it is now, students can only book one session of a Face-to-face activity.  If they're not able to attend the session for whatever reason, how do I let them book another time instead.  I'm still not so sure how to handle this properly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: This did end up complex for us, and screwed with a few other things. So - in the back end, I remmed out the No Show and Partially Completed so the only thing that can be completed is Attended. If the student is a No Show, then the facilitator removes them from the session. In this way, they are not marked as completed, but they are also not prevented from booking into another session. I also have a report that displays reasons for cancelled sessions, and if the user that cancels the session isn't the student, then it reports as a no show. I hope that makes sense. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, it does make sense and it helps.  Thanks! I wish the teacher/facilitator didn't have to manually remove the no shows but I guess it needs to be done.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: Peter, Thank you for sharing the information regarding this bug and your workaround. May I ask what ended up happening with the workaround? Which issues did you run into? In our case, we want to use the functionality of "No Shows" and "Partially Completed", but of course it has to function correctly. Thank you for sharing!

ResponsesInList.Title: F2F - Manager Approval Issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair , I found an interesting bug today.... A F2F course requires manager approval, and a user signs up to the course. An email is sent to the manager, and the student - all is good. However, the student is not given an indication on the screen that they are waitlisted, so they can sign in again. The big gotcha, is once they sign in a second time, even once they are approved and the status as an admin says booked, the end user still has the status as being able to sign up. They will NEVER see on their screen that they are booked in - they will always get the option to sign up. Of course, if they sign up again AFTER they are approved, then they get un-booked and put as waiting for approval, and the whole cycle starts again. Any thoughts? This is latest iteration of F2F and moodle 2.4.3+ (Dated this week) Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F - Manager Approval Issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Actually, ignore this - I found the issue. (My meddling, not yours - my apologies) Ended up because I removed the no show (due to other reasons) by remming the line define('MDL_F2F_STATUS_NO_SHOW',            80); it inadvertantly caused an issue further down, where it would not ever show the person as having been booked in to attend the session. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: F2F Report bug
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair, We had our big launch, and of course a few days before had staff madly adding Face to Face sessions (a few hundred) We were going through the logs and kept finding these seamlessly random students have added a F2F session - needless to say we were incredibly confused. After some chasing, we have found that F2F was injecting into the mdl_log database , and for some reason using the activityid as the userid - hence why we were getting random students in the log... (Including students that had never logged in) I found that line 209 in sessions.php seems to be the culprit add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session', 'facetoface', 'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); My suggested correction is add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session',  'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); Let me know if you want me to raise a tracker for this? (I haven't done one before.... could be interesting) Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jon, Unfortunately, this is a limitation of the fact that the Face-to-face module is a single Moodle activity. The Moodle permission system is as granular as individual activity instances, but no more. If that's a problem for you, the only work-arounds would be to: - split your trainings into different separate Face-to-face activities - or have someone other than the teacher handle the attendance marking. Francois

ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Gordon,

In our case, an F2F activity allows us to schedule our courses in various cities around the country.

If the sessions did not display on the global events calendar, we would have to create them manually, so that our customers would still be able to view these upcoming classes regardless of whether or not they were enrolled in the course or even registered on the site.

This change would considerably diminish the value of the F2F module to us.

I understand how important it must be for other users of the module to have the sessions viewable as a course level event, Perhaps a setup option where you could choose to display the session as either a global or course event would work.

Regards,

Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings! I have been happily using a 1.9 version of moodle with face-to-face for about 4 years, and decided to attempt an upgrade to v2.3.   As per the upgrade documentation, that required going to v2.2 first. Unfortunately, the upgrade failed for the Face-to-Face module, with this error: mod_facetoface Field "shortname" already exists Stack trace: * line 573 of /lib/ddl/database_manager.php: ddl_exception thrown * line 141 of /mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php: call to database_manager->add_field() * line 540 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to xmldb_facetoface_upgrade() * line 271 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to upgrade_plugins_modules() * line 1437 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to upgrade_plugins() * line 269 of /admin/index.php: call to upgrade_noncore() I removed the module and continued with the upgrade, which succeeded, and then attempted to add the face-to-face module again, but continue to get the same error. Is there a way to recover from this? The " Server Checks" page says that everything is ok.  I'm running PHP ver 5.3.8 and mysql ver 5.1.65.14.0.    I installed moodle ver 2.2.6 (planning to then upgrade to ver 2.3). Thanks for any assistance. -- Steve Messinger

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Steve, You should be able to fix this problem by changing the following line in mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php about line 141: $result = $result && $dbman->add_field($table, $field1); needs to be changed to if (!$dbman->field_exists($table, $field)) { $dbman->add_field($table, $field1); } Hopefully after that has been changed the upgrade will work without breaking. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair, 1st thank you for your time.  I'm also getting the same error when trying to upgrade to facetoface 2.2+. I tried the code change you're recommending above but got a different error message.  Here it is.. mod_facetoface Notice: Undefined variable: field in /home/cooptraining/dev/mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php on line 141 Fatal error: Call to a member function getName() on a non-object in /home/cooptraining/dev/lib/ddl/database_manager.php on line 153 Version I'm using: Moodle 2.2.6 (Build: 20121112) My SQL : 5.0.92-log PHP: 5.3.18 Thanks, Pierre

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pierre, Sorry it took so long to reply. I noticed a problem with the post I put up with the fix. On the first line where is says "$field" it should be "$field1". Hopefully once that is done it should work ok. Cheers, Alastair
