ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reminder email period flexibility
ResponsesInList.Text: We set our reminder for 2 days. I would be a little surprised at the request for 3 months. So following logic, 3 months before a face to face session starts, they get an email reminding them of the session. In 3 months, I am sure they would have forgotten... (I know I would) I think a reminder that something is on any more than a few days out is a pointless excersise, but happy to be corrected on this. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reminder email period flexibility
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Willem, Currently there are no plans to extend the reminder functionality. In the future I'd like to change the way the reminders are sent out so it uses the new messaging that is built into Moodle 2. Setting the reminder to 3 calendar months could be slightly hard as different months have different numbers of days, but this can be solved by assuming every month has 30 days. If someone wanted to develop the functionality I'd be happy to include it but at the moment I don't have the time to do it myself. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: One Session with multiple dates turnes to be over after first date/time is over
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everybody, We are using F2F on moodle 2.3 and have the following problem: we crated one f2f session and added multiple dates/times. For example session 1 has the follwing dates/times: start date 01.Jan 13, 13:00 - end date 01.Jan 13, 14:00 start date 10.Feb 13, 14:00 - end date 10. Feb.13, 15:00 and so on.. Our problem is now, that when the first date/time is over, the whole session turnes to "session is over". Are we overlooking something or could somebody tell me, how we manage that the session is not turning to be over, when just the first date/time is over? Thanks in advance for any help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: One Session with multiple dates turnes to be over after first date/time is over
ResponsesInList.Text: I, too, am interested in the answer to Alper's question, as we have the same concern.  Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: One Session with multiple dates turnes to be over after first date/time is over
ResponsesInList.Text: Has nobody an idee how to solve this problem? Or from the other site: How are you handling one session with multiple day/time events? For better understanding i try to better explain what we try to build up within the f2f module: We have one session with multiple days/times. A student can attend at the day/time he/she wants. Let's say an english-course will find place ones a week, but on differend days. The studend should now be able to sign there prefered days/times (for the same session). As the session is always the same i do not see the reason to open  a new f2f-session every week, so we tryed to build this up with the "add new date/time" functionality within the session. The problem is now, when the first date/time is over, the student can't sign-up anymore for the other events in this session as the whole session is turning to be over. Any idees would be very nice.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: One Session with multiple dates turnes to be over after first date/time is over
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alper, When you have a session, that consists of multiple consecutive days or that occurs at 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM every Monday morning for 4 weeks for example, the student signs up for all the days and times you have included in that session. In your first example, if the students in one section meet every Monday, then build a session for them and a separate session for those who will meet every Tuesday.   In your example " Let's say an english-course will find place ones a week, but on differend days.  The studend should now be able to sign there prefered days/times (for the same session)." you need a separate session, not the same session, for the Monday class vs the Tuesday class.  Same activity but different sessions. Once a session starts it is too late to sign up unless the instructor chooses to forgive them for missing the first class and adds them manually. Remember, same Class/Activity but different times, means multiple F2F sessions for the Activity.  The student picks the session they want from those offered and attends all the dates and times listed for that session. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: One Session with multiple dates turnes to be over after first date/time is over
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jenna, Thank you for your replay and the way to build this issue up. Do you know, what the reason or the point behind the functionallity "Add new date/time" is? As i have to build up every date/time as a single/stand-allone-session? Alper

How about a session where you sign up for a 1hour tutorial session every Friday at 10:00 AM for the semester. So many possibilities ..... One session but multiple dates .....

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course registration and face to face
ResponsesInList.Text: Tony, You might take a look at the Auto-Enrol plugin, which does away with the "enrol me" button, making the course registration/enrolment transparent to the user.  The only drawback is that students can not be unenrolled without deleting the plugin. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course registration and face to face

The face-to-face plug-in works like a charm, but requires student to be enrolled. I only want to enroll those who have signed up (confirmed) and not in waiting list. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course registration and face to face
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately, with the way that Moodle is structured what you want probably isn't possible. Most activities will require the user to be enrolled before they can do anything, including signing up for a face-to-face session. The autoenrol plugin will make that transparent (which is what we do now) and if you really want to you could manually unenrol everyone after the session so that only people that actually attended have ongoing access. Is there a reason that you don't want extra people enrolled in the course?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manger's Email and Notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: Melissa, Did you ever resolve this? I created the custom field  "managersemail" and filled it with a default value.  This new field now shows just under "location", "venue" and "room" when I create a new session.  The default value I set is there and it is modifiable. Despite this, as soon as I tick "approval required" for the activity the "You are currently not assigned to a manager in the system ..." warning appears when I try to sign up for a session I'd love to know how to make this feature work.  Can anyone assist with this? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manger's Email and Notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: Jenna, The managersemail needs to be a user profile field and not a custom field within F2F. The manager's email then must be set in each profile. It's a great feature, but does take some setup to get working. Just to make it clear, to create a custom profile field in Moodle 2.0+ go to Settings > Site administration > Users > Accounts > User profile fields . Use the dropdown box to create a new profile field and choose the text input option. Then set the short name to managersemail. The other options can be set to pretty much whatever you want. We set the full name to "Supervisor's Email" because that's the langauge our users would understand, we made the field appear on the signup page and did not lock the field (those are the major setting options). Hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manger's Email and Notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: Melissa, This is the process we will be implementing when we go live in one week. 1. Create the custom user profile field "managersemail" with the default email address of our Admin 2. Hide the new "managersemail" custom field completely from the user 3. Change the email-based self registration process, so that the user email with the link that takes the user back to moodle to confirm the registration, goes to our Admin and not the user registering. 4. Admin receives the email and then manually confirms the registration: Home / ► Site administration / ► Users / ► Accounts / ► Browse list of users 5. Admin then edits the profile and without changing anything in the user profile clicks on "update profile".  This apparently commits the default value entered in the "managersemail" field to the database. 6. Admin sends welcome email to the user and were done. If you leave the email based self reg process as is, you will have to monitor your user account creation carefully and update the new user profiles in as timely a manner as possible. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Manger's Email and Notifications

It is good to know about committing the default value entered in the managersemail field - that would explain why it was not working before.

ResponsesInList.Title: facetoface 1.9.6 and multiple sessions

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: facetoface 1.9.6 and multiple sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tiffany, Multiple signups of the same person in the same session (why) or multiple signups of the same person in multiple sessions of the same activity? To the best of my knowledge multiple signups of the same person in multiple sessions of the same activity does not exist,  although there has been some discussion on this topic. You might consider creating multiple copies of the same activity with differrent dates or create a session with multiple dates and times. What is your objective?  ie what use case do you need to satisfy? Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: facetoface 1.9.6 and multiple sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: We want manager to sign up for an ongoing community event. The even will happen every Monday in 2013 and we want each manager to sign up multiple times until all the slots are taken.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: facetoface 1.9.6 and multiple sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: A. Do you want each Manager to book and attend each Monday session throughout 2013? OR B. Do you want them to book individual sessions because you can not accomodate everyone each Monday? If A, then create one activity with one session containing multiple dates (every Monday) and have them book that event.; If B and its first come first serve, then you would have to create an activity for each Monday session throughout the year.  Again, you will find some discussion on signing up for multiple sessions in the same activity, but I'm not sure that anyone has enabled this in a recent release with custom code.  It's definitely not doable with the current release. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Sign up for a third person - how to enter this thir person's name during sign up process?
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there any possibility for me to sign in another person to a specific course? How can I make it clear that it is not myself signing up, but me for another person?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sign up for a third person - how to enter this thir person's name during sign up process?
ResponsesInList.Text: Is this something to do with the Face to face module (as you have posted there)? Or is it just a general enquiry about enrolling people to courses? If it is the second, then if you are an administrator or teacher in a course then you can enrol the pupil by going to the course administration block>assign roles and then choosing student and selecting that person and moving them into the users of the course box.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sign up for a third person - how to enter this thir person's name during sign up process?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Mary. No, my question is if a person can sign-up someone else for a face-to-face action. To explain it more clearly: We are wondering if we can use this tool for our "on site trainings" registration. The problem is, that people often are signed-up by their team assistants. What we need is way to enter the name of the participant. Otherwise, the assistant will receive the confirmation mail and we would have to remove this person from the attendee list manually and add the "real" participant. Looking forward to any good ideas Thank you and best regards Maike

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sign up for a third person - how to enter this thir person's name during sign up process?
ResponsesInList.Text: Users with teacher roles in the course can add or remove participants to face-to-face sessions, and email notifications are sent to the person who was added or removed. This can be done if the person being signed up is enrolled in the course. This can also be done by the teacher. You can give teacher permissions to the assistants, or define a special role of assistant in Moodle that has permission to assign people as students to courses and to manage face to face participations. This solution will work providing the student is a registered user/has logged in at least once if using LDAP authentication. So here is the full description of the solution: Login as teacher/special assistant role: (If the person is not enrolled as student to the course) Go to "Assign Roles" under course Administration. Search and assign the person as Student if they are not already students on the course. Go to the face to face session management screen. Click Add/Remove users, and you can add people. There is a checkbox you can mark if you don't want the person to get a notification email.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sign up for a third person - how to enter this thir person's name during sign up process?
ResponsesInList.Text: Apparently ity is possible to sign up people for face to face even if they are not enrol in course. This automatically adds them as students to the course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding custom fields by default on installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Everyone, I am thinking of adding some code to create 3 custom fields (location, venue and room) by default on install of the facetoface module. Has anyone got any thoughts or objections to this? It will not have any effect on existing installations but will happen on new installs. Thanks, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding custom fields by default on installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair, My feeling is that session location is probably injtegral to the use of F2F in most applications, so I don't see how this would be a negative having the fields already created. There would be another advantage to doing this.  In our case we deliver the same course/F2F activity in different locations and for our end users the location needs to show in the calendar.  It can't just say "Course 101" when one session is in New York and the other in Dallas.  That's a lot of added clicks to find the next one near you. if you are browsing in the calendar. For others using F2F, maybe they would like to show a different building or campus location in the calendar along with the short name. Since as far as I can determine only the activity shortname displays in the calendar, in order for us to show the location for the F2F session, we have to create a separate activity for each location and then include the location name in the short name for the activity. If you knew that the location field was there you might be able code the module to include the activity name and the session location in the calendar entry. In our example this would mean we could have one F2F activity for the same session delivered in 10 city/locations instead of 10 activities , one for each city/location.  This would also be awsome when we had to output reports for each course. My thoughts All the best, Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding custom fields by default on installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jenna, My intent was just to automatically add the custom fields on install, not to make them part of the standard session. They would still be removable by an admin setting up a session. If its popular I might look into making the fields part of the session and then also look at putting more details into the calendar. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding custom fields by default on installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Alastair, I'm not clear on your meaning "They would still be removable by an admin setting up a session".  Are you just referring to Home / ► Site administration / ► Plugins / ► Activity modules / ► Face-to-face "Custom session fields" Delete. Was not aware they were removable on a per session basis.   Once they were added as a custom session field, they are included in any new session created. Also, are you open to doing custom mods to F2F on a contract basis? Besides having the location info show on the calendar, we also need an Admin approval process that works in a scenario where  customers are approved by a training admin, once course payment has been processed. Right now, my work around is to use "managersemail" with the same default email address for all users.  The big drawback is that the default value is not committed to the database on account creation.  Either the user or admin has to "edit" the profile and update it to get F2F to recognize the default email address.   As we are using email-based self registration, this invloves monitoring new user registrations on a daily basis in order to "activate their account".  If this is not done you get the "you have not been assigned to a manager" error. Solution would be to add an alternate checkbox under "approval required" for an "admin approval required" plus a custom F2F field for the admin email address under this. When admin approval was checked the admin email field would be available to be filled in and all session approval emails would go to this address, instead of the user's manager's email address entered in the custom field in user's profile. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding custom fields by default on installation
ResponsesInList.Text: While I'm thinking how nice it would be to see the session location on the calendar as well as the short name .... even better would be a floating window with location and time when you mouse over the calendar entry. That would be very well you know ... Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding custom fields by default on installation
ResponsesInList.Text: I agree that adding the fields by default would make this more useful right after installing it and reduce some confusion. I also like Jenna's idea of making the location field visible on the calendar as we have the same problem. Sometimes we offer the same training in 8-12 different cities.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F notifications
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Lori, The Waitlist Notification will not be sent if you do not check "Allow Overbooking" when you set up an F2F  session. Regarding the "booking cancellation email", there is no way that i know of to turn off or hide the "cancel booking"  option once a user has registered for a session.  The student will always have the option to go back to the session, cancel and then receive an email notification of their cancellation. Best Regards, Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem in signing up by users/students
ResponsesInList.Text: We're using Moodle 2.1+, so not sure which version you're referring to, but when you installed the plugin it should have added a manager's email address option to the profile field that needs to be completed. The other option is to turn the managers' notices options off for the particular face-to-face that you're having trouble with. That should stop it from preventing the system to work. Another global option (Site Administration>Plugins> Activity modules>Face-to-face) that you can turn on is to let the students add their own managers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: Our service provided indicated that when they tested Face-to-Face Module they identified a major security risk (hole) and alerted us that Face-to-Face Module was not safe to run/install.  We are running Moodle 1.9.11.  Could anyone shed some light on this?  Is there a fix?  This module does exactly what we need and we would like to use it.  Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Glen, The feed back from your hosting provider which i have also received from them is as follows; "editattendees.php uses PARAM_RAW for a search string used to search the database . This is a serious SQL injection vulnerability. (this issue also exists in the 1.9 version". i have no idea how potentially serious this is, but do know that other hosting providers don't seem to be so concerned about it. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Glen and Jenna, Although PARAM_RAW is used, the data is still escaped by Moodle so will not result in an SQL injection vulnerability, nor is the search string stored or displayed to the user so will not result in a XSS vulnerability either. In short this does not appear to be exploitable, however the user of PARAM_RAW is still less than ideal so I have updated the f2f module to use a more restrictive param type - this should keep your hosting company happy. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: The latest code in the git repo at https://github.com/totara/facetoface-1.9 has the fix in. I'll get a packaged release out tomorrow that will include this patch. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Alastair.  This will be very helpful for organizations using Remote-Learner as a hosting provider in the US.  Will you be able to make the same mod to the current 2.0 code? Regads, Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???

I could issue a pull request but noticed there has been one sitting there since the 31th of October that still hasn't been accepted so I'm not sure if they are being actively looked at. I will however message Jeremy Schweitzer and see if he can get it updated. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face for Moodle 2.0/2.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Flotter, The user profile field must be added manually and has to be a "text input" type and have the shortname of "managersemail". The shortname can be changed but the constant " MDL_MANAGERSEMAIL_FIELD" on line #30 of lib.php in the facetoface module must be changed with it. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face for Moodle 2.0/2.1
ResponsesInList.Text: FYI for everyone - Dongyoung has updated the code at Github and it has fixed several bugs that we've found so far (including the Excel problem and calendar issues). It still doesn't not check for the managersemail field and add it if it's missing, so please continue adding it manually for now if you have that problem. Of note is that the module still doesn't support the new course completion or backup/restore features of Moodle 2.0. They are on our roadmap, but probably won't be implemented in the immediate future (in an ideal world they'd be implemented by the end of September, but at this point I can't make any promises). To Mark Adams - if I'm understanding your second issue correctly that's not a bug, but correct functionality. The sessions are what are displayed on the Calendar, the Activity names are for the course page and aren't shown on the calendar. If I'm misunderstanding the issue please test it with the new code and the bug is still present please provide more details.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face for Moodle 2.0/2.1
ResponsesInList.Text: For anyone who's interested, i've fixed the Export. I've realised that this only breaks when you add another date to a session. This feature seems strange to me (i.e. why would a session have multiple dates - surely it would be a new session?). I guess the advantage of it is that you can keep the same attendees across multiple sessions, without having to re-add them. Anyway, look around line 1315 in lib.php, you'll see the following: $ sql = "SELECT s.id, s.datetimeknown, s.capacity, s.duration, d.timestart, d.timefinish FROM {facetoface_sessions} s JOIN {facetoface_sessions_dates} d ON s.id = d.sessionid WHERE s.facetoface=$facetofaceid AND d.sessionid = s.id $locationcondition ORDER BY s.datetimeknown, d.timestart"; and change it to this: $sql = "SELECT s.id, s.datetimeknown, s.capacity, s.duration, d.timestart, d.timefinish FROM {facetoface_sessions} s JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT sessionid,id,timestart,timefinish FROM {facetoface_sessions_dates} GROUP BY sessionid) d ON s.id = d.sessionid WHERE s.facetoface=$facetofaceid AND d.sessionid = s.id $locationcondition ORDER BY s.datetimeknown, d.timestart"; previous code resulted in multiple s.id's if there was more than 1 date. This now returns only the first date for a session. Cheers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face for Moodle 2.0/2.1
ResponsesInList.Text:
how about this sql statement (assuming the default table prefix and standard install)... it took us from 1.9 to 2.1 and everything seems to work... it is not complete as it doesn't migrate the old data to the new format, but the old data is still there, if you want to query it for reporting purposes: 
```text
ALTER TABLE


    mdl_facetoface ADD column ( requestsubject text, requestinstrmngr mediumtext, requestmessage


    mediumtext, shortname VARCHAR(32), description mediumtext, showoncalendar TINYINT(1) unsigned


    DEFAULT '1' NOT NULL, approvalreqd TINYINT(1) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL);


ALTER TABLE


    mdl_facetoface_sessions ADD column ( allowoverbook TINYINT(1) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL );


CREATE TABLE


    mdl_facetoface_notice


    (


        id bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,


        name VARCHAR(255),


        text mediumtext,


        PRIMARY KEY (id)


    )


    ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COMMENT='Site-wide notices shown on the Training Calendar';


CREATE TABLE


    mdl_facetoface_notice_data


    (


        id bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,


        fieldid bigint(10) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,


        noticeid bigint(10) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,


        data VARCHAR(255),


        PRIMARY KEY (id),


        INDEX mdl_facenotidata_fie_ix (fieldid)


    )


    ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COMMENT='Custom field filters for site notices';


CREATE TABLE


    mdl_facetoface_session_field


    (


        id bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,


        name VARCHAR(255),


        shortname VARCHAR(255),


        type bigint(10) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,


        possiblevalues mediumtext,


        required TINYINT(1) unsigned DEFAULT '0' NOT NULL,


        defaultvalue VARCHAR(255),


        isfilter TINYINT(1) unsigned DEFAULT '1' NOT NULL,


        showinsummary TINYINT(1) unsigned DEFAULT '1' NOT NULL,


        PRIMARY KEY (id)


    )


    ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COMMENT=


    'Definitions of custom info fields for Face-to-face session';


CREATE TABLE


    mdl_facetoface_session_roles


    (


        id bigint(10) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,


        sessionid bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        roleid bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        userid bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        PRIMARY KEY (id),


        INDEX mdl_facesessrole_ses_ix (sessionid)


    )


    ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COMMENT='Users with a trainer role in a facetoface session';


CREATE TABLE


    mdl_facetoface_signups


    (


        id bigint(10) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,


        sessionid bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        userid bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        mailedreminder bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        discountcode text,


        notificationtype bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        PRIMARY KEY (id),


        INDEX mdl_facesign_ses_ix (sessionid)


    )


    ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COMMENT='User/session signups';


CREATE TABLE


    mdl_facetoface_signups_status


    (


        id bigint(10) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,


        signupid bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        statuscode bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        superceded TINYINT(1) unsigned NOT NULL,


        grade DECIMAL,


        note text,


        advice text,


        createdby bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        timecreated bigint(10) unsigned NOT NULL,


        PRIMARY KEY (id),


        INDEX mdl_facesignstat_sig_ix (signupid)


    )


    ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COMMENT='User/session signup status';
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Go to course after sign up instead of allsessions?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi When a user sign up for a session and submit - the view returns to "allsessions". In 1.9 the view returned to course/view.php (the actual course main page). I prefer this - is there a way to change so the submit button returns to course main page (a hack tip is okay)? I'm not a programmer, but it looks like the change could be in file signup_form.php: " $mform->addElement('hidden', 's', $this->_customdata['s']); $mform->addElement('hidden', 'backtoallsessions',     $this->_customdata['backtoallsessions']); " If this is piece of cake for somebody - please help

ResponsesInList.Title: Hack: Go to course after sign up instead of allsessions?
ResponsesInList.Text: Related to https://github.com/mynameisdongyoung/Face-to-Face2.0 downloaded from github august 12. When a user signed up, cancelled sign up, or just cancelled sign up or cancelsignup form - the return url is set to "all sessions" (back to the actual facetoface). I wanted the user to return to course main page in all three situations, because this is must common usecase for our users. To this to happen I've made the changes to code as described below, and it seems to work without problems: \mod\facetoface\signup.php (remove optional parameter) //$mform = new mod_facetoface_signup_form(null, compact('s', 'backtoallsessions' , 'manageremail', 'showdiscountcode')); $mform = new mod_facetoface_signup_form(null, compact('s', 'manageremail', 'showdiscountcode')); \mod\facetoface\signup.php (change returnurl directly): // echo ''.get_string('cancelbooking', 'facetoface').''; echo ''.get_string('cancelbooking', 'facetoface').''; \mod\facetoface\cancelsignup.php (remove optional parameter) // $mform = new mod_facetoface_cancelsignup_form(null, compact('s' , 'backtoallsessions' )); $mform = new mod_facetoface_cancelsignup_form(null, compact('s'));

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendance Does Not Save

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance Does Not Save
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joe, The first two things I would do to try to figure out what is happening is to turn on full debugging in Moodle: 1- Set " Server | Debugging | Debug messages" to "Developer" 2- Set "Server | Debugging | Display debug messages" to "Yes" Then have a look at the error log of your webserver. For example, on a Debian system running Apache , that's /var/log/apache2/error_log Also, another thing to check would be your version of PHP. Are you running PHP4 or PHP5? (you can find that from "Server | PHP info"

ResponsesInList.Title: Displaying on the Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I have created loads of face to face items and sessions and people have booked on them.  Initially I may have used my short code on the short name field.  Which unfortunatly others don't understand.  I changed the short names but the orignal short names are displaying. e.g. Face to face session called Word Intro is displaying with the short name 73P1 although this is nowhere in the face to face anymore. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying on the Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Michelle, The reason this is happening is because the calendar only shows "Events" so the Face-to-face items shown in the calendar are not based directly off the face-to-face sessions. Currently when a face-to-face session is created its also creates an event to go with it and when a session or activity is updated it doesn't update the Event. This is why the name is not changing in the event when you update the name of the Face-to-face activity. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying on the Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Any way I can get around this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying on the Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I've got a fix for this issue so now the events on the calendar update correctly when you update the name of the Activity. I've attached a patch with the code to fix it. It hasn't been throughly tested so you may want to try it out on a test installation before using it on a live system. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying on the Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: You should also be able to go into the sessions themselves and resave them and it *should* update the Calendar events (this appears to work with Moodle 2.0, I haven't tested in 1.9).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying on the Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Updating the sessions after updating the activity name should work in 1.9 as Jeremy stated but this could be a major task if an activity had 100+ sessions. The patch I provided will simplify the task by updating events when the activity is updated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Porting the face to face module to Moodle 2.x - another try :)
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all, almost all here, including me, love the face to face module, appreciate the good quality of work (thanks a lot for the creator!) and would be very happy to have a version for Moodle 2.x Currently it seems, there is uncertainty regarding when this work will be finished or even if someone is working on this module at the moment. For more transparency and eventauly a solution, I suggest the following process: 1. Identification if someone is currently working on porting the f2f module to Moodle 2.x and related circumstances. 2. If noone is working on porting the module, finding out who would be able and willing to do it and, in case, if funding is required 3. In case funding is required, identifying would join funding porting the f2f module to 2.x I will try to guide through this process and start with the first point: Is thre currently somoeone working on porting to moodle 2.x? If yes, could you please share some background information? Hope this initiative is appreciated - Thorsten

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Porting the face to face module to Moodle 2.x - another try :)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Thorsten, There has been a number of different attempts on porting f2f to Moodle 2 although most have been incomplete. I've taken the work done by vivek arora which looks to be the most promising and put it up on a github repository . I've started making progress on fixing calls to depricated functions and other problems but having limited time availiable will limit my ability to finish this in a reasonable timeframe and also there are a number of outstanding bugs in the 1.9 version that I am trying also trying to fix. I suggest for anyone wanting to help out, fork the repository and help by fixing some of the problems. I will keep an eye on the repo so I can quickly accept pull requests and help out with questions that may arrise. Let me know what you think. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Porting the face to face module to Moodle 2.x - another try :)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair, hi all, thank you Alastair very much for your reply and of course also your efforts. According the process sugested by myself, we should now move on to the next step and see, who could help Alastair (and what would be the cost, in case). But please allow one small step in between: Yesterday I found a module very similar to the face to face module which is called "booking". It is already available for moodle 2. I have installed and tested it and it works ok. From my experience, it differs only in details from the f2f module. I Would it maybe be better to enhance this module instead of porting f2f? The booking module can be found here: http://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?d=13&rid=4635&filter=1 It's a bit a pity that the author did not enable discussion about his module. Also there is no good documentation so far. Thorsten

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Porting the face to face module to Moodle 2.x - another try :)
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all, as there was no reply regarding the "booking module" I continue now according the above suggested process. I created a new open-source project "Face to Face Module for Moodle 2.X" on Cofundos.org. Confundus is a platform to help with the funding of open source related work. You can view the complete project description at: http://www.cofundos.org/project.php?id=222 Since I assume the project could be of interest for you too I would like to invite you to comment and bid on the project. ResponsesInList.Title: Help with Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everybody, I'm new in using Moodle, and I need help, we have the 1.9.4 version and I want to know if is recommend to use the 1.9.12 version or the 2.0, or could you recomend me wich is more stable. I will appreciate your help thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help with Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello. It all depends how much work you want to make for yourself really The 1.9.4 version is fine but it is always better to upgrade to the latest version so if you are happy upgrading to 1.9.12 then that would be useful. Moodle 2.0 is very different and has different requirements for php/ mysql etc  -and your users need retraining in how to use it. So in the short term I would say if possible upgrade to 1.9.12 but in the long term, when you are more comfortable with it and your users are happy to make the move, go to 2.0.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help with Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Sarai - we recently had to make this decision too, and decided to go with 2.0.  This was a completely new installation, so we felt like it was best to get our users trained on 2.0 from the start and then we wouldn't have to worry about re-training them after a conversion later. We saw a lot of posts about the problems trying to load 1.x courses into 2.x, so we didn't want to create a lot of courses in 1.9 and then have to go through the hassle of converting and testing them all again. We also really like the new activity/course completion features in 2.x, and these were important for our particular situation. It is true that we have had to wait on some desired add-ons to be updated for the 2.x platform.  We're anxious for the Certificate and Face-to-Face modules to get updated and be stable, but we can live without them for now. Overall our experience with the 2.x system has been positive.  The Moodle community is really good as open source stuff goes, and we have an excellent IT support team, so we haven't been too worried about launching with 2.x.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help with Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mary and Daniel for your help

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cant Edit words or phrases

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cant Edit words or phrases

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cant Edit words or phrases
ResponsesInList.Text: If editing php files does not seem to take effect the reason is often in php eaccelerator (enabled) which keeps the old files in a sort of server cache. Check if your php.ini has eaccelerator enabled with line eaccelerator.enable = "1" You can change that to eaccelerator.enable = "0" and restart the server...

ResponsesInList.Title: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Face-to-face will be great for our institution but one issue is the Moodle calandar entry is SITE WIDE. This is not good for us. We need the calandar entry to be Course wide, as we have many different departments / courses using our single install of moodle. As it is, awards, programmes and courses will all have calendar entrys that do not apply to them. Does anyone have a soloution to this? We use Moodle 1.9.7 Many Thanks John

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I'll add +1 to this and have raised a bug report in the tracker for this specific issue if you'd like to vote - http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-2850 If events are course based they must be targeted at individuals on that course, not displayed on the site-wide calendar where they just confuse everyone else. Thanks, Gordon.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: This isn't a bug  - you can disable this behavior under the Face-to-face options by unchecking "Show on the calendar". If you want it to show up on the course calendar you can either add it manually or wait for people to sign up and then it will appear on their own calendars.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I disagree - perhaps it's terminology semantics about what a bug is. Would you be happier if it was called a usability flaw? I have tutors starting to use this actively so the global calendar is getting overwhelmed with course specific content. The default setting is to show on calendar, and if you're co-ordinating training sessions that sounds like the right thing to do. The tick box option can't be disabled by the administrator without hacking the code. If the calendar populated was the course one instead of the site calendar it wouldn't be an issue. After testing this I've also found that if someone saves the event with those default settings then edits to uncheck the calendar box the events remain visible in the global calendar (I'd call that a bug too).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I still wouldn't call this behavior a bug. This is the exact behavior that plenty of people need, so a whole sale change to course specific context would be a regression for us. I see you added this request to the tracker, but I disagree with your characterization. Instead, a new feature request to add the ability to choose the context would more appropriate. I'd also say that the other two complaints are best served by feature requests as neither are technically a bug. A bug is when something doesn't function the way it was intended, in this case each function behaves exactly the way it was designed and are perfectly usable for many scenarios. However, I would agree that adding a way to set the global default for whether an event appears on the calendar or not and an easy way to remove events from the calendar would be useful new features.

ResponsesInList.Title: Updated invite not sent when a F2F is updated
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there -  I noticed today that an updated invite is not sent to attendees when I update the time or date of a face-to-face event. This creates a problem! How do you handle updating an f2f event? Is the best practice to cancel the original event instead and create a new one? Wouldn't the user then have to delete the old event from their calendar? Your tips and ideas are appreciate! Thanks, Kymm

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Updated invite not sent when a F2F is updated
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a workaround I use, the order of actions is important: Export the participants' list for the session (to excel for instance) Use add/remove participants for the session to remove all participants (this send the cancellation emails for the previous session dates) Change the session dates to the new ones Use add/remove participants to add participants 1 by 1 - this sends the new updated invitations to them. I use the exported list form step 1 to search the participants that were already signed up. Regards, Amir

ResponsesInList.Title: Face to Face: assignment of oa trainer
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello! I cannot find a functionality in my face-face-session (1.9.) where I can sign a trainer/teacher to the course. Could you give me a hint where I can find it? Thanks a lot in advance, Hanna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face: assignment of oa trainer
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Hanna, someone here has described 'face-to-face' as a system for using Moodle to schedule 'face-to-face' sessions outside Moodle, or with other words 'face-to-face' module is a booking and attendance system inside Moodle for meetings or training sessions outside moodle. Therefore all logged in users - also teachers - are able to sign-up for a session. Each session itself (outsite Moodle) has his own (and well known) teacher. By the way, I have modified my 'face-to-face' module (e.g. by changing ‘room’ to another description) so that it also allows booking for internal Moodle courses (i.e. private sessions via webconference). Or is the question more like how a non-admin teacher can edit this module? If so,  you will find the answer here . hth Joachim

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face: assignment of oa trainer
ResponsesInList.Text: It is possible to assign trainer/teachers to one or more sessions. Here's what you need to do: 1. As an administrator click Site Administration > Plugins > Activities > Face-to-face 2. In the session roles section, select which roles you want to appear 3. In the Course , click on Administration > Assign Roles 4. Assign people to the roles you previously checked in step 2. 5. Now, when you create a new session (or edit any existing sessions), you should see a new section called 'Session Roles'. This will contain a checkbox for every person who is assigned one of the roles you chose in step 2 in this course. 6. Check one or more of the checkboxes and save the session 7. Now, when users view the session page, they should see the Roles and the Trainers assigned to those roles. Hope that helps, Simon

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face to Face: assignment of oa trainer

ResponsesInList.Title: Some test results for the module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I did some testing with the module's new features (related to moving between states), and got the following results. I can add them to tracker but wanted to make sure these are bugs and not features that have not yet been implemented: Things that do work: When a session is deleted - signed-up attendees get a cancellation message. When a session is changed from wait-listed to a session with a date - a message is sent to signed up students with the new set date/s. When a session is changed from set date to wait-listed (may happen if the date has been "frozen" or new date is still unknown and you don't want to "delete" the session). Attendees get a message that confirms that they are now registered to the wait-list. Suggestions - moving from set date to wait-lisetd - there should be a special notice saying that session has been changed from set date to wait-listed + there should be a cancellation for the outlook meetings of the dates that are now not set. In all these cases + also in the case described below that have other notification problems  the calendar events are updated/added/moved/deleted perfectly. Things that do not work: When there is a session, and it is changed in any of the following ways, participants do not get an email message and/or meeting cancellations or updates: One or more of the session dates is changed and updated session is saved. One or more of the session dates is deleted and updated session is saved. One or more of the session dates is added and updated session is saved. Can someone else try running these scenarios on their installation so that we make sure this is not just on mine? Amir

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some test results for the module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Amir, Thank you for taking the time to do some thorough testing Indeed, the problems regarding changing the date are the result not yet implementing checks. There was some talk here of perhaps locking session dates/times once bookings had been accepted - this would make the problems you describe non-issues. I'm just not sure if that would conflict with how people use the module. Thanks again, Aaron

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some test results for the module
ResponsesInList.Text: We definitely have cases in which we need to change dates when people are already signed-up. Things happen in "Real-Life" such as trainers getting sick or other circumstances that call for changing dates of training. I don't really see the point of "Locking" session dates when someone signed up - if you don't want to do it, simply look if people are already booked and don't change the dates then... At the moment the workaround to get the functionality of updating session dates I use is: Export the signed-up list to excel. Remove users from being signed up - using "Add/Remove attendees" (this sends them the cancellation of dates). Change the dates with no one registered. Add the users again to the updated session (using the excel list to manually search for user 1 by 1) - this sends them the updated session dates and calender invitations. Obviously, automating this is much preferred. Amir

ResponsesInList.Text: This happens for us a s well - using Outlook/ MS Exchange. See this partial solution (only works for face-to-face with single day sessions): http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=127703

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails received twice
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm having this problem too and I'd really appreciate some help. I've established that this only happens when I select a Notification Type of "Email Notification and iCalendar Appointment".  If I select one of the other two options I only get one email - but it's always an email; it never has a calendar appointment attached. I tried adding the script in the link to the partial solution, but then the attachment was just a message with the word "ical" in the Subjet line. Any ideas on where I can start looking to resolve this?  I'd appreciate suggestions.  And I'd really, really appreciate someone just saying "do this" and magically fixing the problem! Mary

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails received twice
ResponsesInList.Text: So in case anyone is interested I cheated.  I went into mod\facetoface\signup.html and removed the code around line 127 that referred to the 'notificationboth' value. So now my Notification Type drop-down field only has "Email" and "Email with Calendar Notification" (I also changed the wording for the available options).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails received twice
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All .. in-case anyone is interested (moodle 1.9.7): I also noticed the same thing, however, I'm not sure I agree that you cheated (Mary) . I think it's a perfectly reasonable modification. When I investigated I found two ways to resolve the issue. Method 1a) Modify the mod/facetoface/signup.html file by removing the select box option with MDL_F2F_BOTH as the value. 1b) Edit the mod/facetoface/lang/en_utf8/facetoface.php file so that 'notificationemail' reads 'Email Notification' and 'notificationical' reads 'Email Notification with iCalendar Attachment' Method 2)a) Modify the mod/facetoface/lib.php file. Line 1616 has an "if" statement that sends an email if the student wanted the ical attachment. Line 1628 has an "if" statement that sends an email if the student wanted an email. These statements are not associated with one another, therefore they run independently. The student would only receive one email if the second "if" statement was an "else if" statement. In that case it would only send out the email without the attachment if the email with the attachment wasn't sent. I think the first method is the best (which is Mary's method). The default "iCalendar Appointment only" is misleading since it sends the ical file as an email anyway, so having the three options doesn't make sense to me (unless someone changes the ical option to prompt the student to download it instead of sending via email).

ResponsesInList.Title: Activity Locking vs Using a Child Course
ResponsesInList.Text: Our courses consist of blended learning. Right now we have two moodle courses set up for each course. One course is for the live instruction portion for which we use face to face. The second is for the online learning content where we have uploaded scorm content. The course is sequential meaning that the online content does not become available until the user completes the live instruction course. I tried using Activity Locking (I'm don't fully understand all of its features yet) but the problems I have are two fold: 1 - We run the same live instruction course in dozens of cities. Each instance/session is its own face-to-face and a user need only attend one face to face session to be eligible for the online content. It seems as if the activity lock is an all or nothing proposition, I can't set it to say that any face-to-face attendance would qualify to unlock the online learning content. 2 - The online learning content is accessible for 60 days from the face-to-face/live session attendance. Any ideas on how to control this? Right now we do this manually. Thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activity Locking vs Using a Child Course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jon. As for issue one if you open just one face-to-face activity but then open different sessions for that activity (these can be on different times and in different locations) this should solve your problem. Actually, I think this should be the correct use of this activity. The only times we open more than one face-to-face activity, is when there is a significant difference between the two - e.g. begineer vs. advanced intructor-led training. I have an idea concerning issue 2. If you use groups and groupings, you can then put the online content (SCORM) to be visible only to a specific grouping , and then define the availability of this resource/activity according to when the group had the training. So, if you put copies of the SCORM activity in the course, only the group members would see it according to the availability setting set within the actvity. Using groups/groupings would also prove valuable to track the grades and completion of activities per group. You can distribute the people in the groups or perhaps better yet - avoiding manual work - give each group a unique key for course enrolment and they are then automatically put into their group. One more thing - is there a specific reason you put the online and face-to-face activities in different courses? Wouldn't it be easier for learners if you put it in the same course - say in topic 1 and topic 2? Best of luck. Ask more if I was not clear.

ResponsesInList.Title: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?

I would like to explore different ways: - either having a confirmation button before sending the confirmation email (kind of approving the attendee's list, that would send the email to the whole list at one time) - or be able to setup a number of days before the session date to send the email for ex. 7 days before (my session events are often de-scheduled ans re-scheduled so I do not want to pollute users mailbox for nothing). If I do so and enable it while having already a list of attendees, what happens ? can we then send the confirmation mail to the list ?? Did anyone already developped something on this subject ? Feedbacks appreciated. Thanks for your help Sandrine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sandrine, If you use the teacher view (from the attendees list) to add/remove students to a Face-to-face session, then you can click the optional checkbox which allows you to suppress the email notifications before you add/remove attendees. That way if you need to add a bunch of people tentatively, you can click the checkbox and they won't hear about it under the reminder email comes in (which you can configure in the activity settings). If you need to remove them from the course before the reminder is sent out, then you can do so from the same page. As long as you click the checkbox before removing them, they will not receive an email. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sandrine, That second email you mention "Welcome to Course Name" is not actually coming from the Face-to-face module. Instead, it's coming from:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?
ResponsesInList.Text: HI François, Thanks for these details. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Not easily. I think that the cleanest solution to your problem would be to introduce the idea of active/inactive sessions. You could create a sesion which would be inactive (i.e. hidden from users) until you are ready to announce it. Confirmation emails would then get delayed until the session is active. Does that sound like it would solve your problem? Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Laundry list of features
ResponsesInList.Text: All We have recently gone live with our Moodle using the FacetoFace module to handle instructor led in-person training classes. We currently have 120 courses with over 350 sessions (this number grows daily as we are required to keep at least 3 months of sessions in place). As my instructors are using the tool they have made suggestions about features they would like to see. I would like to petition the group and 1. See is anyone is currently doing these things, 2. see if you would share your code, and 3. find out how difficult some of these things would be to do. I will do the best I can to explain each of the features. Change cancellations per cancellation policy - We have a cancellation policy that states "if you cancel your attendance within 24 hours of class you will be charged our standard no-show rate." Instructors would like to restrict a users ability to cancel their attendance within 24 hours of the class start time. I see this being done in a couple of different ways: 1. deny cancellations within 24 hours and show a message telling the user to contact our administrative offices. 2. allow the cancellations to proceed but send a message to the user, manager, and admin staff informing them of the cancellation and no-show fee. Thoughts? Being able to track no shows - This is already logged as Contrib-1108 No show emails - Related to the above function, if a person is marked as a no-show send message to user and manager informing them of the no-show. Waitlist - Already logged as Contrib-408 html editor for facetoface emails - Some instructors would like to have the ability to send HTML formatted confirmation, reminder, and cancellation messages. capability to allow a person to add participants but not remove participants - We have some people that will register/book attendees for their department and we want them to be able to add the attendees but not remove the existing ones. Daily view of sessions - we currently have an HTML page that is manually maintained that show all sessions that are happening today. Session information includes, location, venue, room, start and finish times, and if the session has been cancelled. Adding default locations, venues, and rooms - already logged as Contrib-251 Searching for users in sessions - Occasionally we have a user or manager that calls up and does not remember what session they have signed up for. We would like to build a way to search through the sessions to find a specific user and the session they are signed up for. Sign up for multiple sessions - already logged as Contrib-1271 Store deleted sessions in the database for reporting - Already logged as Contrib-1107. I welcome any and all suggestions or thoughts concerning these features. If no one is doing anything like this then I will log tracker issues for each of the ones not already logged. Francois, Thank you for a most excellent tool. It has improved the teaching at my organization immensly. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Laundry list of features
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, We've been live with F2F in a similar setting to your own, healthcare at least, since January 2008 and it has been extremely well received by our organisation, impacting upon course uptake and attendance as well as streamlining our admin significantly. I would certainly echo your view and recognise these suggestions as improvement to an already excellent add-on. For information we use a Face to Face block to review daily sessions I have this link to it if it helps with item 7? My only other suggestion would be a 'print attendance list' button to provide to facilitators prior to the session. Currently we copy and paste into a document for printing or emailing but it would be useful to be able to draw in additonal information beyond firstname, surname. Will complete a quick poll of users here and add if they have any creative suggestions. Ditto your comment to Francois, a brilliant tool. Jeff Burge

I will see if I can get a patch to Francois to review in the next few weeks. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendence linked to online course enrollment
ResponsesInList.Text: Let me start off by explaining the situation. We use Moodle to train technicians around the world but one state requires us to provide face-to-face classes for the technician's first training. After they have taken the face-to-face class they are able to renew their training by taking a course online. (Our training certificates expire every 2 years) The problem is setting up a course just for that particular state that has enrollment limited to those technicians that have already taken a face-to-face class. Some changes would probably need to be made to the core Moodle files as well as the face-to-face code but I would love to have the face-to-face attendence be linked to the online course enrolment somehow. I don't want to have them automatically enrolled in the online course after they attend the face-to-face so the current external enrollment modules won't work for me. When a students attempts to enroll in the online course I would like to have moodle check to verify they have already taken the related face-to-face class, if they have they are enrolled, if they haven't they are told they need to take the face-to-face class first.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendence linked to online course enrollment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dustin,

ResponsesInList.Title: Duration variable issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Admin just installed F2F. Using the F2F gui to set a session to be for example between 3:00 and 3:30 results in F2F messaging producing a substitution as follows... Template-> Duration: [duration] Result-> Duration 20 hours I have not looked at the code, but does it do substraction in a time base (i.e. from 3:20 to 4:40 would be 1 hr 20 mins, (or less optimally, 80 mins) or does it try to do things decimally as in 1.33333333333333333333333 hours which seems a bit silly.... and in either case why would "hours" be used but the number fo minutes unless there was a bug....

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duration variable issue
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, I looked over the code briefly.... It looks like duration is stored as a decimal hour (stange, no? why introduce a decimal when the number of minutes is an integer value) so this finds the decimal component of duration and compues the minutes $minutes = round(($duration - floor($duration)) * 60); and this is obviously the hours $hours = floor($duration); and then I lose my way with

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duration variable issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marc, The duration field is actually separate from the start and end time. This is done because some sessions can be over multiple days. When adding/editing a session, the number that is entered is in hours with fractional numbers allowed (see the contextual help next to that field). Then it is stored in the database as a number of minutes. Finally, it's displayed to users (on the signup page for example) in a nicer human-readable way: 1 hour 30 minutes. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duration variable issue
ResponsesInList.Text: I see now..... However, if I set the duraction per the context help screen to "20 minutes" and save and then copy or re-edit, the field is populated with 20, not 20 minutes, which suggests to me that "20 minutes" doesn;t work..... but if I set the field to .33 that does seem to behave as you suggest..... Soooooo, there is apparently still some issue, though not the one I thought - LOL

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duration variable issue
ResponsesInList.Text: I have just added support for session durations like "1:20" or "0:10" in CVS . Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: User cannot sign up for a 2nd f2f session in the same course
ResponsesInList.Text: Please forgive me if this is a duplicate post, but I did not locate it on the forum. I ran across an interesting issue today....a user was trying to sign up for a face to face session for the second time (he had already signed up for a previous session and wanted a refresher). The user received a message that "(Username) is already signed up for this face-to-face activity." The user had attended a previous session of this activity, but cannot sign up for a second identical session (different date and time). If I remove his attendance history from the previous session, then he can successfully be added into the current session. Although that is a short-term workaround, I would prefer not to use it in order to keep the integrity of our attendance records. I also verified that there is no record written to the 'mdl_facet0face_submissions' table until the user was removed from the previous session. Anyone else have this issue or find a fix? Thanks,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User cannot sign up for a 2nd f2f session in the same course
ResponsesInList.Text: That's a good point. There is currently no support for multiple "attempts" in a Face-to-face activity. The way I can see this get implemented is: - allow students to signup to a session again if the other one is in the past - the grade would be the highest of all of the sessions - there would be a new activity setting to allow/disallow multiple attempts. This does involve quite a bit of development however because the database model will have to be extended to support more than one signup. I have created an issue on the tracker for this: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-1271 Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User cannot sign up for a 2nd f2f session in the same course

ResponsesInList.Title: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
ResponsesInList.Text: All I needed a way to make an individual session unavailable for booking.  Basically the instructor wanted to add students to specific sessions manually without the student signing up themselves.  To do this I changed the code in face-to-face/lib.php as shown below: // Only numbers allowed here $session->capacity = preg_replace('/[^\d]/', '', $session->capacity); $MAX_CAPACITY = 100000; if ($session->capacity < 0) { //changed from a 1 to a 0 to allow session capacity to be set to 0 so sessions can be closed. $session->capacity = 1; } elseif ($session->capacity > $MAX_CAPACITY) { $session->capacity = $MAX_CAPACITY; } The scenario is this:  The instructor has a session that has 25 seats, but 15 of those seats need to be held for a specific department.  Once those 15 seats are filled then the instructor opens the session for anyone else that wants to register.  Setting the capacity to 0 effectively allows the session to be created but makes the session unavailable for students to book.  The instructor(s) adds the 15 students from the department and then two weeks before class starts they change the capacity to the actual capacity of the class opening up the remaining seats to whoever wants to book it. I hope I have explained this well.  In my testing it seems to be working beautifully, I just wonder if I am breaking something else by doing this.  ANy thoughts of comments? Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, I like your solution, I don't think it's gonna break anything. The only thing that you changed is the "< 1" to a "< 0" ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois That is the only change that I made. I wonder if there might be a better way to handle this scenario. Of course better usually means more complicated. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face 2 Face Not in Drop Menu- Activities to add/vers 1.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Luis The Face to Face module should be installed in your mod directory, one level below the Moodle directory. So the directory structure should look like Moodle > Mod > FacetoFace. After you have it in the Mod directory you will need to go to the Notifications screen in Moodle, this will start the installation of the Face to Face module. After it has created/updated all of the tables you should then be able to see it in the activities drop down. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: A couple of problems I have noticed
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois In using the latest version of the face to face I have noticed a couple of things. First, when adding attendees to a face to face through the add/remove attendees screen I am able to add more attendees then has been set in capacity, is this by design or a bug? Second, When a user signs up and selects to receive email and icalendar they are getting two emails one with the confirmation message and one with the ical attachment, again is this by design or a bug. Third, is it possible to attach an html editor to the details or email message editors so that html messages can be sent? The last is more of a request for information, I am not sure what all is involved in making that happen. The first two, if they are bugs I will log tracker issues for them. Scott

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A couple of problems I have noticed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, The first one is by design. This is to allow a teacher to override the limit and sign up more students if they want to. Please file a bug though if it causes any problems (e.g. display problems). The second issue is configurable in the site-wide activity settings. Some mail readers (e.g. GroupWise) turn iCal attachments into a calendar item and make the email disappear completely. These people will need to enable the dual-email option if they want their staff to be able to read the confirmation email. As for the HTML editor, it would be possible to do this, but it hasn't been implemented yet. It is on our TODO list, it simply hasn't been a priority yet. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A couple of problems I have noticed
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois Thanks for the info, it is very appreciated. With regards to the iCal emails. I looked in the site-wide face to face settings and the only option I have is to disable iCal emails for cancellation messages. Is there another option that I am missing? I have version 2008100300. As for the HTML editor, to implement this is it as simple as telling the details and email text boxes to use the html editor or are there other considerations with regards to how the face to face module sends emails out that need to be looked at? Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A couple of problems I have noticed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, Sorry, I lied, the option isn't in the site-wide settings. It's per-user at the time of signup: - "email & iCal": you get two emails - "iCal only": you get a single email with an iCal attachment - "email only": a single email without attachments As for the HTML editor, if you search for "htmlbody" and "posthtml" in lib.php, that should be a good start. I would try to keep the plain text version in there as well for those people who can't get HTML emails (e.g. corporate policy). Feel free to share the good you have, this is definitely something that I'd like to see in the Face-to-face module. Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face 1.4.0 released!
ResponsesInList.Text: A new version of the Face-to-face module has been released. It is highly recommended that you upgrade to it since it includes some security fixes . New features in this release: There is now a list of user cancellations on the attendance page. The Participants report shows the expected data. User-level activity reports ("Outline" and "Complete" reports) are also populated. Other noteworthy improvements: The module now uses a custom field on the user profile page for the manager's email address instead of the MSN field. The attendance data is now stored in the gradebook. Important bug fixes: The session key is now checked in all user forms. The take attendance page now displays the actual attendance and allows teachers to untick checkboxes. iCalendar appointments are no longer sent for wait-listed sessions. Remove internationalisation from log entries. Default email messages are no longer set in the site-wide settings page, they should simply be overridden in the language pack. Francois, Catalyst IT

ResponsesInList.Title: sql table facetoface_sessions_dates question
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have a small question regarding the sql table: facetoface_sessions_dates this tables contains the dates and times of sessions. but I see that the entries have duplicate sessionid. So for each sessionid, I have 2 entries with timestart and timefinish Why is that? Shouldn't there be only 1 entry? Does 1 entry represent the date and the other the time? Can someone explain to me pls why there are 2 entries for each sessionid? 10x in advance

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: sql table facetoface_sessions_dates question
ResponsesInList.Text: You're right, this table can contain more than one date per session. This is to support the multi-day sessions. So for example if you want people to signup for a 2-day first aid course, you can create a single session which requires people to show up on both days. Cheers,

ResponsesInList.Title: Printable Roster for Face to Face
ResponsesInList.Text: All I took the plunge and decided to try my hand at modifying the Face to Face module to have an attendance roster that is printable from the attendees screen. My first attempt is to just be able to do a screen print, but I have run into two problems that I am hoping someone here can help with. The first, I needed several pieces of information from the user profile which I was able to successfully add. I also needed to be able to see a managers name and phone number on the roster. I created two extra user profile fields named Manager Name and Manager Phone. I can see in the db that they were created in the tables mdl_user_info_fields and mdl_user_info_data, but I am having trouble figuring out the sql query to add them correctly to the attendees screen. Second, I added table headings for each of the new fields and then added those strings to the lang file. For the life of me I cannot get them to appear in Moodle correctly. I have attached the files that were modified. Just for reference, in the attendees.php file lines 125 through 132 and lines 153 through 159 were added, in the lib.php lines 823 through 826 were modified, and in the facetoface.php lang file the new strings are at the bottom. Can someone give me some help with this. I would really like to do the work myself but could use some mentoring. After I get this done I plan on changing it a bit more to have a separate print screen that can be accessed from the attendees screen, I think that would be a cleaner way of doing things. Thanks for any help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Printable Roster for Face to Face
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, That's a great idea and I'm sure other people will be interested. Glad you solved your DB problem. Regarding the strings, the only thing that's missing is the second parameter to get_string() which tells it where the strings are located. For example: get_string('unid', 'facetoface'); Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Francois, Many thanks, that was my problem with the strings. They are all working now. Another question, one of the custom fields I created is used to populate a managers email address. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Printable Roster for Face to Face
Re: Printable Roster for Face to Face
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois Forgive my ignorance here.  When changing the msn field would I use the same name designation that was used to view the managers email address in the lib.php? That is if it was $usercheck->msn; I would change it to $usercheck->manemail; Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Printable Roster for Face to Face
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, data for custom fields is stored in the user_info_data table. first you will need to find out the id number of your custom field - use something like this - where 'nameofmyfield' is the shortname of your custom field: $field = get_record('user_info_field', 'shortname', 'shortnameofmyfield'); then something like this to return the data: (where $userid is the id of the user you need the info for.) $info_data = get_record('user_info_data', 'userid', $userid, 'fieldid', $field->id); and then replace $usercheck->msn with $info_data->data hope that helps! Dan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Printable Roster for Face to Face
ResponsesInList.Text: I should have said that you could also combine those 2 calls into a single call to the database using get_record_select() Dan

ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face 1.2.0 released!
ResponsesInList.Text: A new and improved version of the Face-to-face module is now ready to be downloaded: Download latest version It includes the following new features: Teachers can now sign users up for a session, even after the fact. Open Document Format support when downloading attendance Dutch translation by Peter-Anne Wissema But perhaps more importantly, it fixes a number of bugs, including these: Always mark reminders as sent, even when the email to the manager failed. Fix the default permissions to fix problems where a user is both student and teacher. Add an empty db/upgrade.php to fix upgrade problems on Moodle 1.9 Respect the system's date and currency format when displaying dates and costs. More details are available in the change log . As usual, please report bugs in the tracker or ask for help in this forum. Francois, Catalyst IT

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ole,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 24-hour clock
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Francois, Thanks for looking at it. I'm using the default danish language pack. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 24-hour clock
ResponsesInList.Text:
There must be a string that's overwriting the settings in lang/da_utf8/langconfig.php. Here's a way to find out. Add the following line to mod/facetoface/lib.php, at the top of the "facetoface_print_sessions" function: print '

' . get_string('strftimetime') . '

'; This will display the format that is being picked up Moodle directly aboving the "Upcoming sessions" heading. Then, you can hunt for the places where the 'strftimetime' string is defined by searching the contents of files.  On Linux, you can do this from the top-level Moodle directory: grep -r "\['strftimetime'\]" * For example, I get this returned: lang/en_utf8/moodle.php:$string['strftimetime'] = '%%I:%%M %%p'; lang/en_utf8/langconfig.php:$string['strftimetime'] = '%%I:%%M %%p'; I changed both strings to be different values so that I could tell which one had priority over the other.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 24-hour clock
ResponsesInList.Text: Hmm.. strange times... I've searched through all the source code, I can not find the string. Could it be stored in the database ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 24-hour clock
ResponsesInList.Text: Got a bit closer to finding the error. In the language files the timeformat is defined as: $string['strftimetime'] = '%%H:%%M'; However, when i print the timeformat in the face-to-face facetoface_print_sessions function, the result is: %H:%M I've searched the sourcecode, and the strftimetime string is not changed anywhere i can find. Any suggestions on where i could look? Ole

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 24-hour clock

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Version 1.1.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dirk, I haven't been able to reproduce your problem. Here's what I did: 1- took a blank Moodle 1.8 install, added the face-to-face module 2- created a new course "course101" 3- created a new meta course "meta1" which has "course101" as a child course and uses the topics format 4- created two user accounts: "teacher" and "teacher2" 5- from within the meta1 course, I assigned the teacher role to "teacher" and "teacher2" 6- inside meta1, both teachers can create face-to-face activities and sessions Is there anything different with your setup here? Francois
